CanadaHelps is looking for an innovative, goal-oriented, and focused Database Engineer with a passion for social change to join our team. This is an opportunity to join one of Canada’s first and North America’s most successful social technology organizations. We are a fast-growing, dedicated team of entrepreneurial-minded peers who have a passion for helping small- and medium-sized charities succeed, while engaging with donors to increase giving in Canada.We believe technology and data are transformational game-changers for generating social profit. We democratize access to technology by providing best-in-class, easy-to-use online fundraising software and training to more than 25,000 registered charities across Canada (and the number of charities is rapidly growing). We are the market leader and over the past 20 years we’ve helped over 3 million Canadians donate over $2B to Canadian charities.About The RoleThis is a unique opportunity to support our donors and charities and make sure their data remain secure. As a Database Engineer , you will be responsible for managing all of our SQL Servers to ensure our databases are operating optimally in a 24/7 environment. This responsibility includes installation, maintenance, configuration and access control for databases. Making sure Developers are following the best practices while writing scripts which are going to execute in our production environment that will have a direct impact on our customers. The Database Engineer will work closely with the Solution Architect and DevOps team, ensuring the company infrastructure is functioning at all times. You will share responsibility for deploying code to production, helping ensure only authorized changes are promoted to our production environment. As part of this support, you are expected to coordinate with the Solution Architect, DevOps team and the CTO to ensure that someone is always available 24/7 to handle escalation s.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities will include but are not limited to: Design, implement, and maintain our production database infrastructure, including backups, replication, and disaster recovery;  Work closely with the Solution Architect to identify opportunities for future architecture improvements, and contribute to the development of long-term technology strategies;  Coordinate with other members of the Technology team, including developers, team leads, and infrastructure specialists, to ensure that backend/DB changes are rolled out each release;  Provide technical expertise and support to the Technology team, helping to ensure that the backend data model meets the current and future requirements and improvements;  Monitor the database performance and identify areas for improvement, including potential areas for automation or process optimization;  Work closely with our engineering team to design data models and schema for new features and projects;  Create and maintain documentation related to the backend database model, ER Diagrams and also process diagrams;  Develop and maintain scripts and automation tools to manage and monitor our databases;  Perform regular database maintenance tasks, including optimizing indexes and analyzing database storage; Required Skills And Experience 5+ years of DBA experience supporting MSSQL, MySQL and PostgreSQL;  Azure cloud experience (e.g. Azure SQL Database services, Compute, networking, Storage and security);  3+ years of experience installing and configuring Windows servers in a virtualized environment (VMWare experience a plus);  1+ years of experience supporting Active Directory;  Advanced proficiency with SQL and database query optimization; You will excel in this role if you: Have a passion for continuous improvement and learning;  Are comfortable with ambiguity and a fast paced environment;  Understand the performance management process and are dedicated to your team members’ growth;  You own the deliverables;  You enjoy working with different teams and understand that accountability is key; Here is what we have to offer: A chance to make a difference with a unique opportunity to add major value as a key member of a small team;  A Not-For-Profit and a forward-thinking, technology-focused business, (we’re a unicorn! 🦄)  A full-time, permanent position with flexible work, Growth & Development stipend, Health & Dental benefits and RRSP matching  The opportunity to work with super nice people who want to change the world for the better! (and highly respected professionals)  A Mission driven, “get things done”, open, collaborative and flexible environment  A lifestyle friendly, work-life balance Accommodation : CanadaHelps is an equal opportunity employer, and welcomes and encourages applications from all persons including those with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process, please contact accessibility@canadahelps.org so that appropriate accommodations can be made.

Zobility, an RGBSI brand, is proud to be the primary partner to top companies in the mobility, high-technology, automotive, aerospace & defense, media & entertainment, energy, and finance industries. As a result of our clients' continued growth, we are looking for energetic, personable professionals to partner with these leading companies.




Job Description




The System Engineer - Associate will have the responsibility to manage the integration of the electronics systems in the vehicle and to define the functional requirements starting from the stakeholders (Product, Vehicle Integration, Homologation, HMI, Quality, Plant, After Sales) collection requests.
System Engineer shall also guarantee the harmonization of the features among all the Regions and collaborate with the component specialists to guarantee the correct functional allocations taking care of the components constraints.




Main Responsibilities Will Include




Collect the stakeholders requirements for each feature of competence
Define the system high level requirements from the concept phase.
Create and maintain the System Level Models for Vehicle electrical features, using IBM-Rational RhapsodyRelease, maintain and update the vehicle functions documents for high level requirements.
Create and maintain the system technical specifications.
Guarantee the traceability between stakeholders requirements and functional component requirements
Define the correct functional allocation between multiple ECU's on the vehicle bus considering E/E Architecture design.
Release and maintain the System DFMEA
Define the feature description in the Use/Owner's manuals.
Support the validation team to define the test cases and to discuss the open points with the suppliers.
Benchmarking analysis on new solutions for value optimization and quality improvement




Requirements




0-2 years of experience in the area of automotive electrical architecture or electrical systems.
Basic knowledge of automotive Electrical/Electronics systems.
Basic knowledge of Sys ML and Model Based Design (preferred using IBM Rational Rhapsody)
Basic knowledge of DOORS® and other Requirement Management system.
Basic experience in problem solving capability of Electrical/Electronics systems.
Good engineering knowledge about DFMEAAbility to work in team and organize complex tasks
Ability to support/consult work teams
Focus on technical details
Ability to work in multi-cultural teams




Education




Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent from accredited university




We offer attractive, competitive compensation and benefits including, medical, dental, 401k, short-term disability, AD&D, tuition reimbursement, and more. If you take pride in your work and are committed to personal and professional success, let's talk. Please visit www.zobility.com to learn more.




Zobility is RGBSI's workforce management and staffing division. RGBSI is a multi-national corporation headquartered in Troy, MI with branches throughout the USA, Canada, Germany, and India.

Job_title: Health Information Analyst - Decision Support - Regular Full-time (230956)
Job_description:
Toronto, ON, CA Posted: 3/20/2023 4:07:15 PM

We currently have a Regular Full-time opportunity for a Health Information Analyst in the Decision Support Department at our Bayview Campus.

Hours Of Work

Weekdays: Days; 8 hrs; As per schedule

Position Overview

Reporting to the Manager of Coding services, the Information Analyst is responsible for data extraction, data submission, data quality, and reporting of performance data to support evidence based decision making and to advance the operational and strategic goals of Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre. This role will work closely with Decision Support, Finance, Coding, Health Records and Information Services to support internal submission and reporting requirements. The Information Analyst will also interface with various external information management entities, such as Cancer Care Ontario, WTIS, Daily Bed Census and Canadian Institute for Health Information to fulfill certain external reporting obligations.

Responsibilities

Proactively identify opportunities to implement processes to improve data quality related to
DAD/NACRS/OMHRS/NRS and Registration data.
Extract and analyze clinical and operational data from various hospital databases to fulfill reporting requirements, monitor performance and support organizational goals.
Prepare submissions for external reporting (DAD/NACRS/OMRS/NRS) while performing reconciliations across multiple data sources.
Creates reports, dashboard and provide summaries of analysis.
Responds to routine ad hoc request for data or analysis.
Maintains a number of operational Access databases.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications/ Skills

Bachelor’s degree in health care or a related discipline.
Canadian Health Information Management Certification (CHIMA)
2 or more years of relevant work experience.
Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality and accuracy.
Working knowledge of WinRecs Coding/Abstracting system (DAD,NACRS,OMHRS/NRS)
An in-depth knowledge and understanding of HIG’s, RCG, SCIPP and ACW's required.
Foundational knowledge of hospital funding methodologies such as QBPs, HBAM and Bundled Care
Knowledge and skills in report writing (e.g. SQL, SSRS, PowerBI, Crystal Reports)
High proficiency in MS office, especially Access and Excel.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Working knowledge of MOHLTC Reporting Guidelines.
Must be well organized and able to demonstrate high productivity and accuracy with attention to detail.
Able to work independently and within a multidisciplinary team environment, and to exercise tact and discretion with good judgment and problem solving skills.
Adherence to confidentiality policy for sensitive clinical/patient information.
Demonstrated satisfactory performance and attendance record

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 230956 to:

Human Resources

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

To apply, please click "Apply for Position" at the bottom of this page.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Sunnybrook, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days ago. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Title: GCP Data Engineer/ Scientist

Location: Toronto, ON (need profiles who can relocate once offices opens)

Need strong GCP resources

JD-

Crafting, building and running the data driven applications which enable innovative, customer centric digital experiences
Expertise on GCP, Big Query, Airflow, Dataflow, Composer and Ni-Fi to provide a modern, easy to use data pipeline.
Working in cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions
Building a data pipeline to transfer the data from our enterprise data lake for enabling data analytics and AI use cases.

Services

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the analytics pipeline
Assist in evaluating technology choices and rapidly test solutions
Assist the outcome teams in understanding how to best measure their web properties
Collaborate closely with multiple team in an agile environment

Must have

A passion for data and analytics
Experience & proficiency in SQL and at least one other modern programming language (Python, Java, etc)
Interest and ability to learn new languages & technologies as needed
Familiar with the execution sequence of ETL Flows
Experience with Datafusion, Big Query, Dataflow, Composer/Airflow and Ni-Fi
Experience in Python & Spark
Basic understanding of data warehouse, data lake, OLAP and OLTP applications
GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
DevOps practices and tools experience
Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

Great-to-haves

Experience with other Big Data related tools and technologies (AWZ, Azure, Hadoop)
Experience building data-as-a-product assets such as Customer Journey Tables, Advanced Reusable Reporting Queries, Symantec Layers Attributes
Working knowledge of a telecommunication service provider's lines of business
Experience with connectors to data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Tableau, Domo

The Data Science Engineer will play a key role at StackPros, where we design, create, deploy, maintain and grow industry-leading Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data Analytics and Cloud For Marketing products, solutions and services.

The Data Science Engineer will be required to help create and maintain industry-leading quality and efficiency of service and software delivery. They will be a part of the Data Analytics team and will be expected to meet and exceed StackPros’ quality standards, while helping the organization rapidly expand advanced analytics workflows and capabilities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participate in analysis of client data and formulate well-defined problem statements and recommendations for advanced analytical workflows that are usually provided as very open-ended problems
Create and design dashboards by using different data visualization tools to present reports and insights, and support business decision making
Design and develop ETL workflows for serving data to the dashboards as needed
Write complex SQL queries with multiple joins to automate and manipulate data extracts
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns from historical data, generate and test hypotheses, and provide product owners with actionable insights
Create advanced analytical models using advanced statistics, machine learning or other methods for client-specific use cases
Create production-worthy ML workflows and pipelines.
Participate in the creation of Statements of Work and other Prospecting activities that require technical expertise and inputs.
Participate in end to end analytical system design when needed, including end to end ETL, reporting and visualization workflows, ML pipelines (continuous training, continuous serving) and data modelling as required
Design testing process, create and execute test cases for advanced analytical workflows
Troubleshoot and resolve issues and defects


COMPANY-WIDE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain and exceed client satisfaction with StackPros Inc.’s deliverables, day-to-day work and overall value as a partner
Cultivate opportunities for company growth, always seek areas where StackPros Inc.’s role could be expanded
Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations
Maintain dedication toward achieving excellence in StackPros Inc.’s delivery against client needs, and overall success as an organization
Be an enthusiastic, positive and generally awesome team mate, mentor & constantly curious learner
Stay up-to-date on relevant technologies, plug into user groups, understand trends and opportunities to ensure we are using the best possible techniques and tools


QUALIFICATIONS:

Enthusiasm to take on new challenges
Ability to learn and adapt quickly
2+ years experience working on Data systems and advanced analytical workflows built on the cloud. GCP, AWS or Azure preferred
Strong understanding of statistical analysis of data including correlation analysis, outlier analysis and hypothesis testing
Strong understanding of data visualization concepts, different types of visualisation charts and choosing the appropriate visualisations to convey insights effectively
1+ years of experience building interactive dashboards using at least 1 data visualization tool such as Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI or Looker. Experience building visualisations exclusively using Python or other programmatic libraries will also be considered.
2+ years of experience using Python. Java or other programming language experience will also be considered
2+ years of experience using SQL. Experience writing large dynamic analytical queries will be a strong asset
Strong understanding of regression models, classification models, neural networks, decision tree models and unsupervised learning models such as k-means clustering. Ability to analyze a problem and make decisions on the appropriate candidate models for the problem
Experience building machine learning models on large datasets
Experience in hyperparameter tuning and evaluation of ML models
Experience using data science libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, keras, nltk etc. Experience using Tensorflow is a strong asset
Strong understanding of Feature Selection and Feature Engineering concepts
Experience using ETL/orchestration/workflow management frameworks like Apache Airflow preferred, but not required
Strong understanding of and experience with large scale OLAP databases and data warehouses. Strong understanding of Google Cloud BigQuery preferred
Understanding of digital marketing ecosystems and tools like Google Marketing Platform, GA360, Google Ads, Adobe Suite etc. a strong asset
Technical understanding of a range of marketing concepts such as cookie-based data collection, setting and leveraging audience segments, attribution modelling, A/B testing, knowledge of marketing KPIs and their calculation will be a strong asset.
Excellent written & verbal communication skills are essential; candidate should be comfortable presenting and participating in group discussions of concepts with internal and external stakeholders


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

"Work From Anywhere" in Canada policy
100% employer-paid benefits package
Monthly yoga and meditation classes
Regular Lunch and Learns from your Team Mates
Fun Employee Events and Activities
Participation in Community Engagement

Role: GCP Data Engineer

Location: Ontario/Remote

Duration: 6-12+ Months

Job Description

As a Data Engineer, you'll focus on solving problems and creating value for business by
building solutions that are reliable and scalable to work with the size and scope of the
company. You will be tasked with creating a custom-built pipeline on GCP stack, and you
will be part of teams that implement vendor sourced enterprise software, configuring that
software, customizing it, and integrating with other internal systems.

Required Skills

5+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, or related field with experience in manipulating, processing, and extracting value from datasets.
Design, build and deploy internal applications to support our technology life cycle, collaboration and spaces, service delivery management, data and business intelligence among others.
Building Modular code for multi usable pipeline or any kind of complex Ingestion Framework used to ease the job to load the data into Datalake or Data Warehouse from multiple sources.
Work closely with analysts and business process owners to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Coding experience in scripting and languages (YAML, Python, SQL).
Expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) technologies in the data warehousing space (BigQuery, Cloud SQL, Dataflow, Data Catalog, Cloud Composer, Cloud SDK, Cloud PubSub, Google Cloud Storage, IAM, Compute Engine, Cloud Data Fusion, Dataproc, BigTable).
Maintain highest levels of development practices including: technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code, with repeatable quality and predictability.
Understanding CI/CD Processes using Github, Cloud Build, Google Cloud SDK
Willing to work in ET Shift.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
GCP Certified Data Engineer (preferred)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

The Data Engineer (Cloud) will play a key role at Stacktics where we design, create, deploy, maintain and grow industry-leading Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data Analytics and Cloud For Marketing products, solutions and services.

Stacktics will rely on the Data Engineer to support the Data Systems team, in both data engineering and data science-related workflows. The Data Engineer will be expected to meet and exceed Stacktics' quality standards, while helping the organization rapidly expand complex Machine Learning and related applications.

Key Responsibilities:

Participate in continuous delivery pipeline to fully automate deployment of the highly available cloud platform that supports multiple projects
Design and develop ETL workflows and datasets to be used in data visualization tools
Write complex SQL queries with multiple joins to automate and manipulate data extracts
Perform end to end Data Validation to maintain accuracy of data sets
Build tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in the development, test and production environments
Develop reusable processes that can be leveraged and standardized for multiple instances
Prepare technical specifications and documentation for projects
Stay up-to-date on relevant technologies, plug into user groups, understand trends and opportunities to ensure we are using the best possible techniques and tools
Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation
Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate operational processes
Experience in working with Orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience in working in one of the public clouds (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Experience in working with Big Data technologies like Spark, Beam, etc


Company-Wide Responsibilities:

Maintain and exceed client satisfaction with Stacktics’ deliverables, day-to-day work and overall value as a partner
Cultivate opportunities for company growth, always seek areas where Stacktics’ role could be expanded
Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations
Maintain dedication toward achieving excellence in Stacktics’ delivery against client needs, and overall success as an organization
Be an enthusiastic, positive and generally awesome team mate, mentor & constantly curious learner


Qualifications:

4+ years experience in Data Engineering
Understanding of digital ecosystems including online data collection, cloud systems and analytics tools (Google Stack, Facebook, AWS, Salesforce, Adobe Suite etc.) a strong asset
Strong technical understanding of a range of marketing concepts such as cookie-based data collection, setting and leveraging audience segments, attribution modelling, AB/N & multivariate
Excellent written & verbal communication skills are essential; candidate should be comfortable presenting and participating in group discussions of concepts with internal and external stakeholders
Candidate must exhibit an analytical, detail-oriented approach to problem solving
Experience with Jira / Atlassian project management tools is an asset


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

Flexible Remote Working Policy (within Canada)
100% employer-paid benefits package
Regular Lunch and Learns from your Team Mates
Standing desks
Entertainment and Games area
Fully-loaded kitchen: snacks/fruit/drinks
Fun Employee Events and Activities
Participation in Community Engagement
Quarterly CEO coffee breaks

Titre : SQL server JR100015987




Type : contrat de 1 an minimum




Lieu : à distance.Description d’emploi




SQL developer PROFILE




Design, develop, test and deploy sophisticated database solutions using the Structured Query Language (SQL). Extracting data from the Data Warehouse, integrating, preparing, and transforming data, analyzing and modeling data, producing statistical tools and studies, producing deliverables and supporting the business deployment.




Work with lead business/data analyst and business actors to understand their business needs and design tools that support those needs.




Create complex functions and stored procedures, analyze queries, develop security protocols, resolve problems, and optimize performance.




Design database architecture, write complex queries for applications and business intelligence reporting, or create dashboards. Experience in an integrated development environment.




Build reporting tools, running complex queries for large data sets.




Troubleshoot database issues and provide support to end users.




Manage reporting/dashboard tools like Power BI.




Dynamic personality, strong analytical, communication, interpersonal skills, eagerness to learn.




Working in an Agile, dynamic environment {Iterative approach}. Client, Delivery centric approach.




Technical SKILLS




Programming languages: Python, SQL, SAS, R, HTML|CSS.
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL Workbench.
Data Viz & Reporting tools: Power BI, Dash, Plotly, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Excel.
Data Science: Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, PySpark, Beautiful Soup, Selenium, Top2Vec, NLTK.
IDE: Visual Studio Code, Jupyter Notebook, Spyder, Rstudio.




Other tools: Git & Github, SPSS, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint.




Other skills: ETL, quantitative and qualitative research




Languages: English, French




Experience : 4 years +

Job Description:

On behalf of our client, Affinity is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join their IT team to focus on project and application delivery.

Responsibilities:

• Identify business processes in order to identify business requirements and develop well-aligned business solutions.

• Project management tasks (queue grooming, running scrum/ sprint planning, etc.)

• Testing, requirements gathering and documentation for application development.

• Troubleshooting operational issues

• Development work and interfacing with business users on requirements

• Collect, analyze, document, and manage business requirements

• Data visualization and analysis skills (Tableau and SQL)

Qualifications:

• Analytic skills - proficient in one of the following: Microsoft Excel, Tableau or Power BI

• Experience with requirements gathering and documentation related to business processes

• Experience retrieving and manipulating data programmatically (Python, SQL, or other technology)

• Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines

• Excellent written and oral communication skills

• A team player who is keen to learn and contribute.

• Perceptive problem solver who wants to think outside of the box & help contribute new solutions

Affinity Earn:

Know someone who’s great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/

About Affinity:

Affinity Group is a full-service Information Technology services and staffing company. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on five core principles: Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility – Inclusivity.

We teamed up with ClimatePartner on 2022 to offset our emissions and move toward being a more environmentally friendly company and we are proud to now be officially Carbon Neutral Certified.

For more information on Affinity, please visit www.affinity-group.ca

Job Description




Job Title: Data Centre Engineer




Work Location: University Ave Toronto, (some work may be in Mississauga - 10%)




Shift: Daytime shift: 9-5 Mon-Fri




Duration: 9 months




Interview: Phone screening + video conference




Job Description




Looking for a Junior/Intermediate Data Centre Engineer with 3-5 yrs. experience.




Data Centre is Linux Cent/OS physical servers, 3 RACs with 10 Servers per RAC.




Windows and Linux Office.




24/7 Production Data Centre,




Scripting in Python, C++ and Matlab.




We are looking for a candidate with a solid experience in cloud server/facility management and operations in our office and data centre. Scope of this work includes troubleshooting and fixing servers with hardware/software and network issues for users, working with researchers/engineers in Fujitsu Consulting (Canada) Inc. and Fujitsu Laboratories/Business Units in Japan. The candidate is also expected to participate in research activities on large-scale computer systems to realize real-world applications with exponential speedup, such as drug discovery and climate prediction. Job duties include scripting codes using these computing resources, and analyzing/optimizing overall performance. The candidate is responsible for the following services during standard work hours, which are described below.




Responsibilities




Manage and administer servers, networks, operating systems and services such as Kubernetes, Docker, OpenLDAP, DNS, and NFS
Diagnose system performance, update computer systems and resolve hardware/software issues
Install, configure, and maintain switches, servers, firewalls, hard drives and software
Conduct inspections on power and cooling systems to ensure they are operational and efficient
Organize the floor space for easy accessibility
Optimize network through data analysis
Provide technical support
Prepare reports, analyze data and metrics
Manage large amounts of inbound and outbound calls/emails in a timely manner
Create and document operational procedures
Work together with experts from other teams on projects




Basic Qualifications




3+ years of experience deploying and supporting servers in a 24/7 production data centre environment
Strong experience working in Unix/Linux environment
Strong verbal, written, and analytical skills and the ability to communicate and interact with team members even in Japan
BA/BS Degree in Technical field or equivalent practical experience
Capable of working with minimal supervision
Solid foundation in programming/scripting language, version control systems.
Experience writing scripts to automate administration tasks.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience administering server cluster orchestrated by Kubernetes




Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Are you a Campaign/Marketing Data Analytics Specialist looking for a new opportunity?

Are you looking for a new contract opportunity?

We are pleased to offer you a new contract opportunity for you to consider: Campaign/Marketing Data Analytics Specialist

Start: ASAP

Estimated length: 12 months

Location: Toronto

Advantages

You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.

Responsibilities

Provides analysis and reporting to enable direct marketing strategy by engaging in sales lead evaluation, direct marketing campaign measurement, and client centric analyses for the credit Cards LOB.

Responsible for understanding credit card acquisition and retention programs and campaigns and the impact that they have in card members/clients.

Conducts deep-dive analytics to provide business insights to assist the Cards team in meeting their strategic goals. Familiarity with test vs. control and A/B testing campaign performance assessment methodology.

Analyzes how campaigns drive client behaviour. Provide analytical support in the creation of cardholder journey stories and presentations to Senior Management, including monthly and quarterly business review presentations.

Performs a consultative role in working with multiple card stakeholders and with cross-functional teams on card analytics.

Understands and meets the needs of Cards stakeholders, including supporting with ad-hoc requests.

Informs and updates leaders, team members and business partners on relevant information in a timely manner

Qualifications

2 - 4 years of experience in a consultative role focusing on data analysis.

Previous experience in the credit card business (Banking or credit card industry)

Experience manipulating and synthesizing large volumes of complex information from multiple sources.

Strong knowledge of data modeling and statistical analysis techniques.

Experience working with multiple stakeholders.

SQL experience

SAS experience

University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, Math or other quantitative discipline.

Excellent relationship building, verbal and written communications skills

Time management

Ability to present information in an organized and concise manner

Good communication and storytelling skills.

Nice to Haves:

Digital analytics experience

Summary

Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Lieu de travail:Montreal, Québec, CA, H3B 2N2Service: IT Applications (IT01)Fondée il y a deux siècles, Produits forestiers Résolu est un chef de file mondial de l’industrie des produits forestiers. La Société s’est développée à partir d’une vingtaine de sociétés antérieures et a fait vivre des centaines de collectivités.Résolu possède ou exploite une quarantaine d’installations et des actifs de production d’électricité au Canada et aux États-Unis. Nos plus de 6 600 employés travaillent assidûment pour produire de la pâte commerciale, du papier tissu, des produits du bois et des papiers de qualité qui sont commercialisés dans au-delà de 50 pays.Nous offrons un milieu de travail valorisant et sécuritaire, riche en occasions et en défis qui vous permettront d’accroître vos compétences.L’établissement de Montreal, (Québec, Canada) est à la recherche de personnes compétentes en vue de pourvoir un poste de Analyste, Données et Rapports. Il s’agit d’un poste temps plein à permanent.Dans ce poste nouvellement créé, vous deviendrez un élément clé d’une équipe d’intelligence d’affaires en pleine croissance. Vous travaillerez dans une équipe dont l’objectif de configurer des modèles de données et de donner les outils et l’autonomie nécessaire aux différents départements d’affaires pour leur permettre de prendre des décisions judicieuses fondées sur les données. Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec les architectes, analystes d’application et département d’affaires.Vos défis :Analyser les besoins des différents départements d’affaires;Comprendre le modèle de données de l’entreprise pour le traduire et structurer efficacement les données pour permettre la production de rapports en mode libre-service;Jouer un rôle d’influence et de leadership pour mettre en place et maintenir un modèle efficace de gouvernance des données composé de représentants des TI et d’affaires;Construire des cubes de données d’entreprise en fonction des besoins des différentes lignes d’affaires de l’entreprise;Identifier les besoins futurs en matière de rapports Power BI et travailler avec les départements d’affaires pour créer une feuille de route de livraison basée sur les besoins/priorités;Suivre et faire la promotion des meilleurs pratiques pour la conception des rapports Power BI;Construire et maintenir des rapports et des tableaux Power BI;Mettre à jour la documentation du système.Votre profilRelevant du Directeur application – Intelligence d’affaires, vous ferez partie d’une équipe dynamique reconnue pour son sens de l’initiative et son véritable esprit d’équipe.Baccalauréat en informatique ou dans une discipline connexe ou expérience équivalente;Minimum de 5 à 7 années d’expérience pertinente dans la mise en place de modèle de données et de la gouvernance des données dans un poste semblable;Expérience récente dans le développement de rapports et KPIs avec la suite d’outils Microsoft;Expérience pratique dans le cadre de divers projets ou équipe BI.Vos compétences :Expérience pratique dans la création de modèles de données et la mise en œuvre de la gouvernance des données aux sein d’équipes multidisciplinaires;Expérience pratique dans la mise en oeuvre et la maintenance d’un modèle de données à la grandeur d’entreprise qui supporte le développement de rapports en mode libre-service;Expérience dans l’exécution de divers ETL;Maitrise du Data modeling dans un environnement infonuagique et multicouches;Excellente connaissance d’outil de rapport tel que Power BI ainsi qu’une connaissance des concepts de Data Lake, Data Warehousing avec des outils Microsoft sont un fort atout. L’intention de Résolu est de continuer à tirer parti des actifs Microsoft dans ce domaine;Connaissance de SqlServer et des bases de données relationnelles est un atout;Comprendre SQL et être prêt à apprendre le SQL avancé;Capacité de travailler de façon autonome et au sein d’une équipe;Capacité de fournir des résultats de qualité en respectant les délais, voir en les devançant;Motivation, jugement et capacité à prendre des décisions;Excellentes aptitudes à la communication en anglais et en français et capacité d’expliquer clairement des idées complexes;Capacité d’analyse à la résolution de problèmes;Capacité de gérer les tâches et les priorités dans un contexte de travail d’équipe à un rythme rapide.Notre offre Salaire concurrentiel et prime annuelleAu moins trois semaines de vacances et trois congés mobiles par année dès le premier jour de travailGamme complète de couvertures d’assurance collective dès le premier jour de travailService de télémédecineRégime de retraite à cotisations déterminées, avec participation généreuse de l’employeur, dès le premier jour de travailProgramme d’aide aux employés et à leur famille Programme de soutien à la formation et au Job Title: Datastage Developer




Location: Toronto,ON




Job Description




Skills Required:




Demonstrable experience as a DataStage developer
IBM DataStage certification or similar
Proficiency in SQL or another relevant language
Knowledge of data modeling, database design, and the data warehousing ecosystem
Skilled at the ideation, design, and deployment of DataStage solutions.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work within a multidisciplinary team




Roles & Responsibilities




Designing and building scalable DataStage solutions
Configuring clustered and distributed scalable parallel environments
Updating data within repositories and data warehouses
Assisting project leaders in determining project timelines and objectives
Monitoring jobs and identifying bottlenecks in the data processing pipeline
Testing and troubleshooting problems in system designs and processes
Improving existing ETL processes for the business




Thanks & Regards,




Aaron




Account Manager

This is a contract position for a Business Intelligence Specialist - Junior for our client who is in the Broader Public Sector. Work location will be in Downtown Toronto

This is a Hybrid Role with 3 days in the office a week. This is a mandatory requirement of the role and is non negotiable outside of exceptional circumstances.

The Contract runs for one year.

Hours per day will be 7.25.

Advantages

Good Compensation working on projects that will make a difference to the people of Ontario.

Responsibilities

Key deliverables to be performed by the Business Intelligence Specialist role include, but are not limited to, the following:

Supports Client’s wide-ranging business information requirements, implementing and supporting business intelligence software solutions

Develops and supports customized query applications which analyze key business data

Develops and supports guided analysis and drill-down functionality, routine scheduling and notification of report generation, and effective implementation of “opportunity” and “key-trend” alerts.

Provides Clients with approach options and tools for managing business-related data in a manner that assists in quantitative analysis of progress and the relationship between operational actions and their effect on business objectives.

Develop presentations for various audiences, as required.

Work with the business and IT areas to complete any activities required to accomplish above and other deliverables as required during the assignment.

Transfer skills and knowledge to selected OPS staff.

Qualifications

Demonstrates business analysis experience in an environment where Oracle, Informatica and Cognos are used together for data warehousing and business intelligence.
Experience working with data warehouse systems and understanding the design and concepts of it.
Demonstrates experience creating complex SQL scripting for data analysis and profiling
Demonstrates experience designing and developing BI Reports, Dashboards and other Business Intelligence solutions using Cognos 10 or higher and Microsoft Power BI
Experience with analyzing data in source systems to identify data cleanliness issues (E.g., missing values, duplicate meanings, and invalid data)
Demonstrates strong MS Excel skills, including working knowledge of Power Query, Pivot Tables
Demonstrated experience advising on existing data sets, models, and transformations to enhance business intelligence reporting
Experience gathering and eliciting requirements for BI application (Cognos and Power BI)
Experience with systems design and development, and related methods, techniques, practices, and standards.

BOMBARDIER




Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.




We have an immediate opening in Bombardier, Aircraft Maintenance Data Analysis for a “Reliability Analyst” in Montreal.




In your role, you will:




Monitor the reliability and direct maintenance cost of the Bombardier in-service aircraft fleet using data collected from various sources including Bombardier ERP system, aircraft operators and maintenance tracking software such as CAMP
Perform in depth analysis on aircraft, systems and components to identify reliability and direct maintenance cost issues
Utilize Weibull and other statistical techniques in calculating and forecasting reliability of aircraft systems and components
Identify recommendations and/or corrective actions in collaboration with other departments including Engineering and evaluate their potential impact on aircraft reliability and direct maintenance cost
Support aircraft reliability and maintenance cost improvement initiatives and present progress reports regularly to management
Produce regular reliability and direct maintenance reports on the Bombardier in-service aircraft fleet, specific aircraft operator, system or component
Assist in gathering and resolve quality issues with aircraft reliability and maintenance cost data in accordance with Bombardier standards.
Improve the automation of Bombardier’s aircraft reliability and direct maintenance cost database and reporting system




As our ideal candidate,




You hold a university degree in Engineering.
You have five (5) years of experience with reliability and statistical analysis in the aerospace industry preferably.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities and experience using statistical methods such as Weibull
You have superior computer skills and advanced knowledge of MS Access, Excel, Project. Knowledge of VisualBA, SAP, Oracle and BI tools such as PowerBI is an asset.
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills are essential.
You are able to work independently and as part of a team.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in French and English.




Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.




We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.




Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Longbow Advantage is an end-to-end warehousing strategy company that leverages real-time data to manage people, processes, and warehouses through The Rebus® Platform, and WMS consulting services purpose-built to expand and enhance warehouse technologies.



We take a holistic approach to warehousing strategy, understanding that technology is only one piece in the solution process. Our warehouse experts work with customers to understand challenges and goals, developing a recommendation that’s aligned to the customer’s business objectives and supply chain initiatives.



What to expect



We’re looking for analytical and passionate Techno functional Analyst to join our expanding team. As an Analyst at Longbow, you’ll play a key role in configuring and delivering critical business functions to your clients and support every phase of the implementation lifecycle.



Once you join our team, you will…



Provide product consulting, transfer of knowledge to client team
Assist with configuration of solutions to meet customer requirements
Assist with RF device, printer and other device configuration and support as needed
Assist client team members through all phases of the implementation
Assist project team to manage client expectations to accomplish project success
Meet with customers and LBA team members to consult, configure, implement and support client requirements
Assist in assessing customer business needs & design and configure appropriate solution document “as is” and “to be” processes
Assist customers with testing, as appropriate based on the Blue Yonder/RedPrairie/JDA solution being deployed
Assist in the development of enhancement specifications for custom development
Create or obtain test scripts to validate functionality against design requirements to ensure customer expectations are fulfilled.
Document testing results and reports bugs, fixes or changes required to Systems Analyst.
Ensure a suitable test environment and supporting data is available, prepared and scheduled for functional testing.
Assist in functional end user training
Provide go-live operations support
Guide business users on the operation of the application and the administration of business processes, reference data, etc.

Skills & Experience



Bachelor’s degree in Business/Supply Chain/Operations/Computer/Software Engineering or related degree
Expertise in Blue Yonder/JDA/Red Prairie,or other Supply Chain Software systems (e.g., WMS, WFM, TMS) both as functional and technical analyst is highly desirable
Experience in an operational setting or relevant discipline
Strong knowledge of SQL Server and Oracle
Experience in documenting process flows and operational procedures
Operating systems – Windows and UNIX
XML/HTML, MOCA, Python/Perl, Visual Studio/Visual basic
Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team
Excellent problem-solving skills
Valid driver’s license
Able & willing to travel

Why Join Longbow?



Supportive work environment
Work/life balance
Competitive Salary
4-weeks of paid vacation
6 paid sick days, 2 paid personal days per year
Excellent health and dental benefits, eligible as of your first day!
Group RRSP/401k Matching
Work from Home

Job_title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Quality Assurance Analyst
Job_description:
About Us

As a Data Warehouse Quality Assurance Analyst you must be results-oriented, self-motivated and have the ability to thrive in a fast-pace environment. This role requires frequent interaction with project managers, product managers, ETL and reports developers and business users in order to ensure that we deliver a quality-tested platform to our users. QA analyst ensures the data loaded into the warehouse is accurate and presented correctly on the reports; identifies any potential data errors and works with development to resolve errors. QA analyst also reviews reports for data accuracy and functionality integrity versus requirements presented by end users, project management and product management.

Who We Are

As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe-- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development-- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

Position Details

What You Will Do

Strong background in functional testing with the ability to design and develop test strategy and test cases.
Ability to review technical requirements with data warehouse and business intelligence terminology to produce test strategies, test scenarios, and test cases for the data warehouse team.
Creates the Test Plan for the software release, defining resources, and test suites required for each test cycle, dependencies, risks, and the overall strategy for testing complex systems and applications.
Performs all aspects of verification, including functional, structural, regression and system testing.
Experience participating in all aspects of a full-lifecycle development methodology, and related quality concepts and processes.
Ability to lead a distributed testing effort.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to work in an agile environment with an iterative approach to development

Who You Are

3 - 5 years’ experience EDW testing.
Good to have P&C domain knowledge or Experience
Proficient in SQL and database systems
Track record of completing assignments on time with a high degree of quality.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to set priorities and multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Extensive knowledge of testing process, testing methodology analysis and defect reporting tools.
Ability to work independently and productively under pressure.
Strong organizational skills and decision making ability.

Our Commitment

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Bell ne se contente pas de construire des réseaux de calibre mondial, d’élaborer des services novateurs et de créer du contenu pour des médias multiplateformes : elle révolutionne la manière dont les Canadiens communiquent.




Si vous êtes prêt à donner corps à des idées innovantes et à vous joindre à une entreprise qui encourage l’imagination, le développement professionnel et le mieux-être de ses employés, l’équipe Bell est faite pour vous.




Principales responsabilités




Diriger l’exécution de la stratégie de déploiement du territoire et fournir des suggestions d’optimisation
Gérer la transformation des données pour fournir des pistes de campagne grâce à l’outil SalesForce CRM.
Travailler dans divers environnements de base de données comme Teradata pour créer et fournir des données garantissant la précision et la qualité du territoire
Analyser différents problèmes de données et participer au processus de résolution.
Analyser et évaluer le rendement du territoire et des canaux de vente.
Gérer efficacement l’analyse des résultats et la production de rapports sur le rendement des canaux de vente destinés à différents intervenants.
Participer à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de nouveaux processus et de nouvelles initiatives pour favoriser les activités et la croissance des canaux de vente
Assurer l’intégrité, la conformité et le rendement optimal des lignes directrices actuelles sur la génération de pistes de vente
Travailler en collaboration dans un environnement d’équipe et établir des relations de travail avec des groupes multidisciplinaires, comme l’informatique décisionnelle, les équipes Marketing, Services régionaux et Service à la clientèle




Qualifications Essentielles




Solides aptitudes pour l’analyse de données et la résolution de problèmes et grande créativité dans l’élaboration de solutions.
Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft, en particulier Excel.
Maîtrise des langages de programmation comme SAS, SQL, Tableau, Teradata, etc.
Aptitude à travailler dans un milieu de travail dynamique et trépidant et à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément grâce à une priorisation efficace.
Solides aptitudes pour l’analytique d’affaires et compétences financières.
Aptitudes exceptionnelles pour la communication




Qualifications Souhaitées




Bilinguisme (français et anglais), un atout.
Diplôme universitaire en informatique, en administration des affaires, en ingénierie ou en mathématiques
Expérience en administration Salesforce.
Compétences en matière de visualisation SIG : création de tableaux de bord et analyse SIG/géospatiale.
Expérience en planification du territoire et en gestion des effectifs.

Our Banking client in Toronto, Ontario is looking to hire a Business Analyst - IT for a 5-months contract role with possibility for extension.




What You Will Do…




Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies.
Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers.
Prepares cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation.

Supports one or more highly complex business processes.
Works on multiple projects as a project team member
Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.




Must Have Skills

8+ years of technical experience as a Business Analyst

Previous exposure or experience within the Banking/Financial Industry.

Aviya Aerospace Systems is a leader in engineering services and solutions for mission critical Aerospace and Defense applications. Aviya provides expertise in program management, systems, software, mechanical, and hardware engineering to many of the top-tier Aerospace and Defense Contractors. We have openings for Systems Engineers to join our engineering group in Longueuil, QC. New graduates are welcome to apply.




Specific Position Duties




Provide support and analysis to design and development activities of advanced gas turbine engine technology.
Interface with various engineering teams.
Evaluate data to ensure engineering principles, customer requirements, and environment challenges to meet quality standards.
Perform system integration testing of designed control/diagnostics systems.
Analyze engine data and troubleshoot.
May perform other related duties as assigned.




Qualifications For Position




Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical or Aerospace Engineer.
Solid knowledge in gas turbine, thermodynamics, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics for Mechanical Engineers.
Experience in MATLAB and Simulink (asset).
Experience with C, Python and other scripting languages.
Demonstrate strong performance in a team environment.
Adaptability to a variety of assignments.
Strong organizational skills.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills and analytical thinking skills.
Ability to influence and negotiate.




For further information please visit us at www.aviyatech.com .

Title: Data Analysis Standards Specialist   Location: Mississauga, ON   Duration: 12+ Months          Background:   Looking for a Data Standards Specialist with proven experience in data analysis and reporting using Client and CDISC ADaM standards and ability to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders at the molecule/indication project level (PDD and beyond).   The ideal candidate will join the Data Analysis subteam of Data Standards and Governance (DSG) and help shape our global data standards to enable automation and FAIR data!   Main responsibility will be to develop ADaM specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain.      As Biomedical Data Standards Specialist (BDSS), your main responsibilities are to:   Develop analysis dataset (ADaM) specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain   Develop standard TLG template and endpoint derivation specifications, also in collaboration with Pharma Data Governance SMEs   Maintain analysis standards metadata in GDSR for use in our clinical trials, data marts and technology projects (e.g., Project Botany-Orchid Garden, Frictionless Insights-Admiral)   Collaborate with other BDSS from DSG and cross-functional SMEs from PD, gRED, pRED and Medical Affairs under the Pharma Data Governance Framework to develop beginning-to-end standards from data collection to data analysis, in one or more disease areas         Skills/Experience:   Senior ADS with extensive experience in data analysis and reporting, leading molecule programs (establishing project/molecule standards) or filing   Understanding the usage of Knowledge Graphs (or ability to adopt the technology) is helpful as the GDSR metadata is stored in graph   Proficiency in R strongly desired; could help bridge Orchid Garden and Admiral   This role comes with endless opportunities to enhance your leadership skills and broaden your impact, contributing to continuous improvement of our internal work processes and tools. As a group DSG helps drive a culture based on FAIR data principles across the Client organization.         Must Have Skills   Well versed in CDISC ADaM standards   Solid experience in statistical programming for data analysis and reporting, establishing project/molecule standards, or filing   Communication and effective stakeholder interaction         NOTES:   Experience in I2ON studies is helpful but not required; current focus areas as determined in collaboration with Data Sciences TA Squads include multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's disease, respiratory diseases, inflammatory bowel disease, ophthalmology, lupus and multiple myeloma

Job_title: Data Analytics & Automation Specialist (15 months contract)
Job_description:
Job Description

Organon est une entreprise de santé des femmes qui croit en une meilleure santé pour chaque femme, chaque jour! Nous sommes une communauté internationale de milliers de personnes passionnées qui se consacrent à redéfinir l’avenir de la santé des femmes. Notre mission consiste à offrir des médicaments et des solutions efficaces pour une meilleure santé au quotidien. Mais ce qui fait vraiment fonctionner Organon, ce sont les membres de notre personnel.

Nous sommes à la recherche de vrais joueurs d’équipe passionnés, d’innovateurs curieux, de penseurs avant-gardistes, motivés par l’idée de façonner leur carrière et prêts à passer à l’action pour accueillir le changement et les occasions de progrès qu’il apporte.

Chez Organon, vous profiterez du meilleur des deux mondes : la culture ouverte, agile et collaborative d’une entreprise en démarrage, et l’envergure d’une entreprise du Fortune 500, qui a une présence internationale et sert les gens sur plus de 140 marchés.

Ce sera un avenir prometteur – venez y participer!

Sous la supervision de la responsable de l'intelligence d'affaires et de l'analytique, le spécialiste en analytique et automatisation des données sera chargé de fournir un soutien à divers projets au sein de l'équipe d'opération commerciale et d'excellence stratégique. Il ou elle contribuera à divers projets analytiques ayant pour but de supporter l'entreprise à prendre des décisions basées sur des données probantes.

Principales Responsabilités

Recommander et exécuter l'optimisation et l'automatisation de différents processus et rapports d'affaires
Effectuer des analyses commerciales de haute qualité pour identifier les opportunités et fournir un soutien fondamental aux décisions d'affaires et au suivi des performances
Développer des modèles de données afin de mieux comprendre les besoins de l'entreprise (modélisation des comportements de prescription des médecins, cibler les efforts de vente, modélisation des réponses promotionnelles, etc.)
Préparer, compiler et rapporter des indicateurs de performance clés pour diverses exigences commerciales
Soutenir l'équipe avec des projets d'affaires et/ou des analyses ad hoc

Études Minimales Requises

Baccalauréat avec préférence en informatique, science des données, business (intelligence d’affaires), ingénierie (logiciel)

Expérience Et Compétences Requises

Expérience dans la création de rapports et de tableaux de bord, de préférence en utilisant Power BI
Maîtrise de SQL
Expérience avec les langages de science des données (R, Python)
Expérience dans l'automatisation de processus d'affaires
Maîtrise de l'informatique (Microsoft Office, Powerpoint, Excel, etc.)
Capacité à établir et à maintenir des relations de travail efficaces avec les membres de l'équipe et les équipes interfonctionnelles
Capacité de travailler de façon autonome, avec peu de supervision
Capacité d'apprendre et d'appliquer rapidement de nouvelles informations
Expérience en analytique au sein de l'industrie pharmaceutique et connaissance des ensembles de données IQVIA est un atout
Compétences linguistiques : Bilingue requis (français et anglais)

Qui Nous Sommes

Organon propose des solutions de santé ingénieuses qui permettent aux gens de profiter de la vie au maximum. Notre entreprise mondiale du secteur des soins de santé génère un chiffre d’affaires de 6,5 milliards de dollars et s’engage à faire toute la différence pour les femmes, leurs familles et les communautés dont elles s’occupent. Nous développons notre importante gamme de produits importante en investissant dans les besoins non satisfaits liés à la santé des femmes, en donnant accès aux principaux produits biosimilaires et en touchant des vies grâce à une gamme diversifiée de solutions de santé fiables. Notre vision est claire : Chaque jour, une meilleure santé pour chaque femme.

Aux représentants des agences de recrutement, veuillez lire attentivement :

Organon LLC n’accepte aucune aide non sollicitée des agences de recrutement à l’égard des possibilités d’emploi. Tous les curriculums vitæ soumis par des agences de recrutements à un employé de notre société sans la conclusion préalable d’un accord de recrutement écrit valide pour ce poste seront considérés comme la propriété exclusive de notre société. Aucun honoraire ne sera versé si un candidat est embauché par notre entreprise à la suite d’une recommandation d’une agence avec laquelle aucune entente préexistante n’est en place. Lorsque des ententes d’agence sont en place, les présentations sont propres au poste. Veuillez ne pas appeler ni envoyer de courriels.

Secondary Language(s) Job Description

Organon is a Women’s Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women’s health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.

We’re looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.

At Organon, you’ll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a Fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.

It’s going to be an exciting future—come be a part of it!

Under the supervision of the Business Intelligence and Analytics Manager, the Data Analytics & Automation Specialist will be responsible for providing support to various projects within the Commercial Operations and Strategic Excellence team. The analyst will contribute to various analytical projects aimed at supporting the company in making data-driven decisions.

Primary Responsibilities

Recommend and execute the optimization and automation of different business processes and reports
Deliver high quality commercial analytics to identify opportunities and provide foundational support of business decisions and performance monitoring
Develop data models to better understand the business (understand patterns in prescription behavior, better target sales efforts, promotion response modeling, etc.)
Prepare, compile and report information and key performance indicators for diverse business requirements
Support the team with ad hoc business projects and/or analyses

Education Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree with preference in Computer Science, Data science, Business (Business Intelligence), Engineering (Software)

Required Experience And Skills

Experience building reports and dashboards, preferably using power BI
Proficiency in SQL
Experience with data science languages (R, Python)
Experience in automation of data processes
Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office, Powerpoint, Excel, etc.)
Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with team members and cross-functional teams
Ability to work independently, with little supervision
Ability to learn and apply new information quickly
Experience in analytics within the pharmaceutical industry and knowledge of IQVIA datasets is an asset
Language skills: Bilingual required (French and English)

Who We Are

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

Job Description




At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected for the eleventh consecutive year in 2023 a s one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers . Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.




McCarthy Tétrault employees benefit from a hybrid work environment.




As a Financial Analyst, Business Insights you will be:




Firm Reporting/Analysis




Reporting on a regular (monthly/quarterly) and ad hoc basis of Firm, practice, region, industry group, timekeeper, client, or matter revenue results, for our internal and external clients.
Developing/maintaining report templates for revenue and profitability reporting for use by the Professional Resources, Clients & Markets/Business Development, Client Service Delivery and other firm leaders.
Supporting the ongoing development and automation efforts for the above reports, including efforts to enable self-serve reporting capabilities (via BI/SSRS tools or SharePoint) for internal clients.
Involved in variance analysis over key line items and departmental budgets/forecasts. Prepares other ad-hoc analysis as required.
Assists in the preparation of monthly department expense reports and management reporting packages.




Business Planning Support




Contributing to the Firm’s revenue budgeting and forecasting processes and annual attorney admissions/bonus analysis, including data gathering and input, productivity and rate analysis, and assistance with the preparation of executive-level presentations.
Supporting the Director & Manager, Business Analysis with data gathering and analysis required as part of the annual standard and non-standard rate setting exercise, including the ongoing maintenance of special rates for clients/matters and rates for new timekeepers.




Project & Team Support




Conducting external research and analysis of the Firm’s results against the benchmarking information available.
Supporting the setup/maintenance efforts of new hire Timekeeper IDs nationally.
Assist with various finance projects as well as partnering with other functional groups on projects impacting finance. Undertakes business process efficiency reviews and system automation opportunities.




As our ideal candidate, you will distinguish yourself by the following profile:




Bachelor’s degree in a related field (eg. Accounting, Finance or Business Administration).
Accounting designation or Master’s Degree (MBA) – preferred.
3-5 years of related work experience post-graduation.
Expert proficiency with Microsoft Excel, including formulas, pivot tables and macros (VBA). Strong proficiency with Microsoft PowerPoint. Solid working knowledge using Outlook, Microsoft Word.

INTRO




Canada’s leading science and technology organization is looking for a software developer with expertise in database development and a strong curiosity for cyber security.




Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) is a world leader in developing peaceful and innovative applications from nuclear technology through its expertise in physics, metallurgy, chemistry, biology and engineering. CNL's cyber security research team is based in Fredericton, NB, and conducts leading edge research in cyber security of instrumentation and control systems for the nuclear industry and other critical infrastructure. The team is in need of an experienced database developer who can give visibility and accessibility to a large repository of information elements. The opportunity involves both back-end development work and front-end user interface work. The position offers an individual the unique opportunity to lead database product development work in the cyber security domain.




The successful individual will have a passion for producing quality code, is responsive to user needs, and driven to produce products that exceed customer expectations.

Job_title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Application Support  Analyst
Job_description:
About Us

As EDW production Support Analyst responsibilities involve to ensure timely resolution of Production Support issues and partnering with the team to mature the operating model.

Candidate is expected to exude a take-charge attitude towards problems and thrive for excellence. This is a hands-on, delivery focused role.

Who We Are

As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe-- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development-- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

Position Details

What You Will Do

Assist with troubleshooting application system related issues.
Identify solutions to business system problems.
Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationships
Create and maintain requirements, issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates.
Diligently support and lead where needed, various activities between the teams to ensure the business and technical requirements and objectives are met.
Participate and contribute to the overall system(s) design.
Assist with the creation of test suites, execute testing and support the QA process.

Who You Are

3 - 5 years’ experience EDW Production Support.
Good to have P&C domain knowledge or Experience
Proficient in SQL and database systems
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to set priorities and multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Ability to work independently and productively under pressure.
Strong organizational skills and decision making ability.

Our Commitment

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Titre du poste: Analyste Développeur BI

Numéro de la demande: 26507

Catégorie d'emploi: Administration

Division: Nat - Systèmes d'information (80069756)

Département: Technologie de l'information

Lieu de travail: METRO - LAVAL - BOUL ST-MARTIN (#M-LAVL)

Province: Canada : Quebec

Type d'emploi: Permanent

Sommaire

Le titulaire aura comme mandat, en tant qu’analyste-développeur BI, de concevoir et développer des flux de données performants qui respectent les standards mis en place.

Responsabilités Spécifiques

Effectue, à partir d'un mandat, tous les travaux inhérents à l'analyse, au développement aux tests et à l'implantation de nouvelles solutions analytiques ou à la modification des solutions existantes.
En collaboration avec les analystes fonctionnels, définit et clarifie les besoins des utilisateurs et participe à l'élaboration de solutions.
Assure la qualité des flux de données, de la documentation, des guides destinés aux utilisateurs et respecte la méthodologie ainsi que les normes et standards de développement en vigueur.
Développe et supporte les flux d’intégration de données robustes et évolutifs incluant les flux en temps réels (streaming), en temps quasi-réel (near real time) et en lot (batch).
Fait respecter les règles fonctionnelles et techniques ainsi que les normes de conception et de

livraison de solutions

Effectue du support à la production (suivi de production et support aux utilisateurs) selon un horaire préétabli (jour, soir, nuit et jours fériés).
Effectue toutes autres tâches connexes.

Critères D'admissibilité

Baccalauréat en informatique ou dans un domaine pertinent.
Au moins cinq (5) ans d'expérience dans un rôle d’ingénieur de données ou développeur ETL.
Expérience pertinente des plateformes Cloud AWS et de ses composantes comme S3, Redshift, Python.
Une solide expérience de travail de conception et d’optimisation de pipelines de données sur de grands volumes de données structurées et semi-structurées.
Connaissance du domaine de la vente au détail et/ou logistique est un atout.

Compétences

Flexibilité dans la gestion de son quotidien
Orientation vers un travail/service de qualité
Connaissances techniques et professionnelles
Communication interpersonnelle
Gestion des priorités
Autonomie
Apprentissage rapide et soutenu
Résolution de problèmes

Metro valorise, respecte et mise sur les différences et les compétences de ses employés provenant de tous les horizons. Nous considérerons toutes les candidatures qualifiées.

Seuls les candidats sélectionnés seront contactés.

Nous demandons respectueusement aux agences de ne pas communiquer avec nous ou nous faire parvenir des candidatures non sollicitées.
