Imagine Everything develops software that helps identify at-risk kids in addition to assisting with student planning, records management, websites, visitor entry, and more. The education space is filled with passionate and creative people, it’s our privilege to work with and support them, as it’s also our privilege to work with people like you to design and build great solutions.




Our Junior Support Developer will be responsible for working directly with school boards to investigate issues at a technical level, provide feedback to the rest of the development team, and provide quality assurance related testing. This is a junior level position making it a great opportunity to learn and grow your skills with full stack development, high scalability SAAS based architecture, or DevOps. Success requires delivering timely and personal responses to school boards while ensuring every one of our education partners maintains their grin like a kid in a candy store.




As part of this role, you can expect to be:




Working directly with school boards over email, phone, and video conference to investigate and triage issues as well as provide code-level support for challenges that may be simple to solve
Investigating issues at a code-level and provide feedback to developers about possible reasons why an issue may be occurring (you may get funny memes, unusual, but overall happy emojis, or encouraging hero-like remarks over Slack if you happen to solve any of them)
Providing quality assurance services for both the product and development team and contributing UX or acceptance feedback based on your testing
Advocating on behalf of our school boards to ensure timely responses to all incidents (think Tom Cruise in “A Few Good Men”)
Writing clear, concise, and consistent documentation about issues, areas for product improvement based on trending support patterns, and making additions to our product manuals that can alleviate support
Constantly working to automate support by providing quality documentation, videos, or any other means that allow school boards to self-serve when it comes to common questions or troubleshooting about our technology
Working outside set parameters and innovating and improving your area of the organization by exploiting autonomy and critical thinking
Learning about the CI/CD process, how to deploy new features in progressive SAAS-based technology stack, and how our technology is deployed across cloud-based computing infrastructure such as AWS and Azure (we provide time and resources to expand your development knowledge)


We have a few expectations.




In order to succeed, you’ll need to have:




Entry-level experience designing and implementing full-stack software solutions; as a junior position, post secondary and bootcamps qualify as experience provided you are comfortable working with front-end frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue as well as setting up or interfacing with REST API’s on stacks such as Node/Express, Golang/Gin, Scala/Play, etc.
Familiarity with common development IDE’s and database tools as well as writing and executing raw queries using SQL (or ORM’s if you prefer to build reports or aggregate data at a code level)
Extraordinary writing and speaking skills that focus on a consultative, collaborative tone when diagnosing and solving problems, including the ability to negotiate and arbitrate successful outcomes with school boards
The ability to work as a team and an individual when given high levels of autonomy and flexibility, especially knowing we are a fully remote work environment that focuses on measurable results rather than “clock punching”
A strong willingness to learn; you will be expected to develop and maintain your own learning plan (with help and supervision) as well as leverage company resources to grow your familiarity with either full stack development or DevOps related tasks
An eager and a fearless attitude when approaching new technologies
At least 10 years of Star Wars hermeneutics or equivalent sci-fi background (let’s just say you don’t want to trip up on a case of mistaken identity by calling Plagueis a jedi in a team full of space loving developers)

At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Developer, Analytic Engine, Developer Framework

Job location: Ottawa, Ontario- Hybrid; Other Canadian locations - Remote

About The Team

We are a group of generalist programmers and C++ specialists, working together to democratize the creation and extension of algorithms in the RapidResponse platform. We are a fast-moving, collaborative team, and each of us is passionate about what we do. Would you like to join us on the road to something new, big, and exciting? If you have the skills below and want to work in a compelling product area – please talk to us!

What You Will Do

Use a variety of modern technologies, and work across the software development lifecycle from development through build and into testing and test automation. You will:

Develop high quality, well-crafted code that delivers value to our customers
Test the work of other team members and develop automated tests
Collaborate as a core member of our development team and across the organization
Support a variety of special projects as needed

What We Are Looking For

3+ years of industry software development experience, preferably on enterprise-scale products
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or an equivalent program
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Passion for writing well-crafted, maintainable, robust, unit-test covered code
Experience with data structures, algorithms, multi-threading, and other core software concepts
Ability to quickly grasp, prototype and communicate new technical ideas
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
A willingness to learn new technologies and development approaches
Someone who actively engages and values working collaboratively

Generalist

Professional development experience with a variety of programming languages including Java/C#, Typescript, and others

C++ Specialist

Professional development experience with C++
Knowledge of C++ STL containers

Things that Would Definitely Help

Experience building tools for developers (e.g., SDKs)
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Jenkins, and Maven or Gradle
Experience with design patterns
Experience working with cloud platform

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Relevant du Lead IA vous aurez la charge du développement de fonctionnalités AI appliquées à nos productions (NPCs, foules, combats...) et participerez activement au développement des améliorations nécessaires à l'évolution constante de notre moteur. Votre rôle consistera à amener la qualité de la technologie d'Intelligence Artificielle du studio au-delà des standards en vigueur dans l'industrie.




Responsabilités




Vous participez à l'amélioration et l'extension de moteur interne d'intelligence artificielle, et son intégration dans les projets.
Vous travaillerez sur les sujets suivants :
Les mécanismes de déplacements de NPC dans l'environnement comme la génération de NavMesh, le path find, le steering et les évitements ;
Les outils d'aide à la prise de décision tels que les Behavior Trees, Rule based systems ou le choix de positionnement tactique ;
Les comportements sociaux comme le suivi, la fuite, la patrouille, les mouvements de groupe ou la synchronisation entre agents.
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les level designers et les scripteurs pour répondre de la façon la plus efficace possible à leurs problématiques de production.
Vous serez force de proposition sur les évolutions du moteur d'IA et sur la meilleure façon d'assurer une production fluide et optimale du projet.
Vous travaillerez de manière rapprochée avec le moteur d'animation & les animateurs, afin de fournir les solutions les plus adaptées a la locomotion d'IA.
Expériences & Qualifications




Diplôme en informatique ou en génie informatique (ou toute autre formation équivalente) ;
Connaissance des techniques d'intelligence artificielle appliqué aux jeux vidéo ;
Maitrise du C++ ;
Bonnes connaissances en mathématiques ;
Vous parlez couramment le français ou l’anglais. Le bilinguisme est un atout.
À PROPOS DE QUANTIC DREAM




Quantic Dream est un studio de création de jeux vidéo créé en 1997 par David Cage, basé à Paris en France et à Montréal au Canada. Les expériences uniques proposées par Heavy Rain™, Beyond: Two Souls™ et Detroit: Become Human™, ont touché des millions de joueurs à travers le monde et remporté plus de 250 récompenses internationales. Ils ont largement contribué à la reconnaissance de la narration interactive dans les jeux vidéo.




Depuis 2019, Quantic Dream est un éditeur soutenant la création vidéoludique et les créateurs indépendants proposant des visions singulières et originales. Le studio leur apporte son expertise, ses moyens de production, le financement nécessaire, et l’accès aux marchés internationaux et leurs audiences. En 2022, Quantic Dream a entamé une nouvelle étape de sa croissance en rejoignant NetEase Games, la division jeux de NetEase, afin de développer sa vision créative et accélérer le développement de titres phares redéfinissant l'expérience interactive pour les joueurs du monde entier.




Pour plus d’informations, visitez le site officiel : http://www.quanticdream.com.




QuanticDream s’engage pour la diversité et l’égalité des chances. Notre équipe est le reflet de cet engagement.

OUR COMPANY BACKGROUND & CULTURE

UPP is a ground-breaking jointly sponsored pension plan tailored by and for Ontario’s university sector. Today, we manage $11.8 billion in pension assets and proudly serve over 37,000 working and retired members across four universities and 12 university-sector affiliated organizations. Our commitment is to protect the security and sustainability of our members’ pensions while delivering service excellence to our members and employers. UPP is a sector-wide plan designed for growth - our doors are open to all Ontario universities.

Our people are the heart of our organization. Together, we are creating a purpose-driven and inclusive workplace focused on a culture of teamwork, collaboration, and respect — for one another and the world around us. We’re looking for passionate individuals seeking a rewarding career and opportunities to build and shape an exciting new organization with a clear mission, and who share our core values of integrity, inclusivity, ingenuity, and impact.




THE ROLE

As part of a growing and dynamic People team, the Analyst, Data & HRIS Service Excellence will play a key role in maximizing technological capabilities within the People department and provide value-added support by leveraging data and insights to support the various People Centres of Excellence (COEs). Reporting to the Manager, Organizational Effectiveness & Total Rewards, the Analyst, Data & HRIS Service Excellence will be responsible for providing high-quality analytical support, process optimization and expertise to the People COEs.

This is an exciting opportunity for a driven analyst with a keen eye for detail to join a team of high performing professionals and make a significant impact.

This role is based in downtown Toronto under a hybrid work policy, allowing employees the flexibility to work remotely and in-office (approximately two days per week in-office).







SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Assess, research, and synthesize quantitative and qualitative data and stakeholder needs.
Run queries, build assumptions, perform statistical and predictive analysis, and build comprehensive reporting packages to present insights and recommendations to People Team Leadership
Design and create dashboards to visualize People data, including but not limited to insights and trends in the areas of Total Rewards, Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Reconciliation (EDI & Reconciliation), Talent Acquisition, and Culture & Engagement
Develop and continuously improve analytical models to assess the performance of People programs.
Identify gaps and implement innovative technological and analytical solutions to increase the efficiency, integrity, and accuracy of HRIS reporting.
Plan, conceptualize, and design compelling and impactful graphics, charts, report templates, and presentation decks to strengthen the People team’s messaging.
Ensure accuracy and precision of formatted materials such as reports, presentation decks, and templates
Collaborate with cross-functional People teams to provide analytical guidance and support for various initiatives and ad-hoc projects, as required.
Optimize HRIS processes by supporting the Manager, Organizational Effectiveness & Total Rewards with regular HRIS maintenance and testing for upgrades and enhancements.
Support with other projects and ad-hoc analysis as required.




QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

Undergraduate degree / College diploma, preferably in quantitative field of study (e.g., Analytics, Statistics, Math, etc.)
Minimum 3+ years of relevant experience
Strong MS Excel skills and a high level of analytical capabilities, attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Excellent project management skills and ability to work under pressure and manage projects with multiple or competing deadlines.
Proven ability to communicate and synthesize medium to complex ideas or large amounts of data into simple and concise presentations and reports.
Strong work ethic, team player with the ability to build strong relationships.
Strong understating of data modelling methodologies and best practices for data visualization techniques
Experience with Ceridian Dayforce is considered a strong asset.
Programming skills (e.g., VBA, Python, etc.) are a preference.




ATTRIBUTES:

Excellent written and verbal communications
Ability to design, execute, and improve repeatable processes.
Independent problem solver
Ability to organize and drive results from multi-layer matrix stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong statistical, analytical, and quantitative skills
A nimble, resourceful team player who takes ownership of their work thrives in a start-up environment.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrated ability to meet high performance standards and maintain a calm, pleasant demeanor in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.







PERSONALITY TRAITS:

Adaptable
Self-driven
Humility
Strong work ethic
Passion for learning
Empathetic
Collaborative
Authentic
Personable
Confident
Pro-active problem solver
Ownership mindset

Job Description




Role: Data Centre Engineer




Location: University Ave, Toronto, Ontario (some work may be in Mississauga ~10%); Candidates MUST be available to work onsite 2-3 days.




Duration: 12+ months




Interview Schedule: phone screening + video conference




Data Centre is Linux Cent/OS physical servers, 3 RACs with 10 Servers per RAC.




Windows and Linux Office.




24/7 Production Data Centre,




Scripting in Python, C++ and Matlab.




We are looking for a candidate with a solid experience in cloud server/facility management and operations in our office and data centre. Scope of this work includes troubleshooting and fixing servers with hardware/software and network issues for users, working with researchers/engineers. The candidate is also expected to participate in research activities on large-scale computer systems to realize real-world applications with exponential speedup, such as drug discovery and climate prediction. Job duties include scripting codes using these computing resources, and analyzing/optimizing overall performance. The candidate is responsible for the following services during standard work hours, which are described below.




Responsibilities




Manage and administer servers, networks, operating systems and services such as Kubernetes, Docker, OpenLDAP, DNS, and NFS
Diagnose system performance, update computer systems and resolve hardware/software issues
Install, configure, and maintain switches, servers, firewalls, hard drives and software
Conduct inspections on power and cooling systems to ensure they are operational and efficient
Organize the floor space for easy accessibility
Optimize network through data analysis
Provide technical support
Prepare reports, analyze data and metrics
Manage large amounts of inbound and outbound calls/emails in a timely manner
Create and document operational procedures
Work together with experts from other teams on projects




Basic Qualifications




3-5 years of experience deploying and supporting servers in a 24/7 production data centre environment
Strong experience working in Unix/Linux environment
Strong verbal, written, and analytical skills and the ability to communicate and interact with team members even in Japan
BA/BS Degree in Technical field or equivalent practical experience
Capable of working with minimal supervision
Solid foundation in programming/scripting language, version control systems.
Experience writing scripts to automate administration tasks.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience administering server cluster orchestrated by Kubernetes

Come work as a Data Engineer with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!




Reporting to the Director and operating within the context of a client service culture to provide organizational leadership with respect to information management and analysis, quality measurement and evaluation and utilization strategies, the Data Engineer identifies, develops, implements and maintains an innovative response to the quality, utilization and other information needs of Vancouver Coastal Health. Responsibilities include consultation services, detailed analysis of information including confidential data files; user needs assessment and requirements surveys; integrated report design; development of appropriate database structures and development of dashboards, key performance indicators and balanced scorecards.




As a Data Engineer with Vancouver Coastal Health you will




Develop and establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation and implementation
Collaborate with a variety of cross-functional team members to identify, develop, implement and maintain innovative solutions for the information needs of Vancouver Coastal Health.
Apply experience in data modelling, data warehousing, building data pipelines, and excellent problem solving ability to tackle processing of high volumes of clinical data




Education & Experience




Master’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems or equivalent industry/certification experience
Three (3) years experience in Information, Utilization Management and Quality Management.




Knowledge & Abilities




Working knowledge using cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g. Azure SQL, Synapse Analytics, Databricks, etc.)
Preferred knowledge of Azure or other cloud infrastructure services
Demonstrated experience building and optimizing data pipelines (ETL) using SSIS, Azure Data Factory
Preferred experience with Azure DevOps
Preferred proficiency coding in Python, Scala, R, Java
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of database design and report design at the intermediate to advanced level.
Knowledge of healthcare databases an asset.




As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?




VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve, and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff




Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.




We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.




Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2023.

At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Developer, Analytic Engine, Developer Framework

Job location: Ottawa, Ontario- Hybrid; Other Canadian locations - Remote

About The Team

We are a group of generalist programmers and C++ specialists, working together to democratize the creation and extension of algorithms in the RapidResponse platform. We are a fast-moving, collaborative team, and each of us is passionate about what we do. Would you like to join us on the road to something new, big, and exciting? If you have the skills below and want to work in a compelling product area – please talk to us!

What You Will Do

Use a variety of modern technologies, and work across the software development lifecycle from development through build and into testing and test automation. You will:

Develop high quality, well-crafted code that delivers value to our customers
Test the work of other team members and develop automated tests
Collaborate as a core member of our development team and across the organization
Support a variety of special projects as needed

What We Are Looking For

3+ years of industry software development experience, preferably on enterprise-scale products
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or an equivalent program
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Passion for writing well-crafted, maintainable, robust, unit-test covered code
Experience with data structures, algorithms, multi-threading, and other core software concepts
Ability to quickly grasp, prototype and communicate new technical ideas
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
A willingness to learn new technologies and development approaches
Someone who actively engages and values working collaboratively

Generalist

Professional development experience with a variety of programming languages including Java/C#, Typescript, and others

C++ Specialist

Professional development experience with C++
Knowledge of C++ STL containers

Things that Would Definitely Help

Experience building tools for developers (e.g., SDKs)
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Jenkins, and Maven or Gradle
Experience with design patterns
Experience working with cloud platform

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

Job_title: Drug Database Associate - 12 months contract - Express Scripts Canada
Job_description:
Position Summary




Through the work of the Drug Pricing Services team, Express Scripts Canada offers its customers access to a comprehensive drug product and price file database of drug identification numbers (DINs) and drug prices for drug claim adjudication. The primary function of the Provider Data Analyst is to update and maintain the master drug file and the provincial price files for ESC customers using their knowledge and experience from retail pharmacy.




Delivers specific delegated tasks assigned by a supervisor in the Provider Data job family.




Responsible for accurate, timely maintenance of complex provider information and synchronization of data on all claims and provider databases including expertise on business requirements for multiple business regions.




Participates in the design of data tracking and monitoring tools.




Participates in system testing and analysis in support of new functionality, new system processes, and business rules changes.




Validates data to be housed on provider databases and ensure adherence to business and system requirements of customers.




Researches, resolves complex exceptions and error reports, determine regional/cap/business indicators for multiple business areas to assure accurate reimbursement based on provider contract and area fee schedules.




Interprets update requests and coordinates with internal and external customer to clarify and complete. Contributes to completion of projects and programs in area of expertise.




Completes day-to-day Provider Data tasks without immediate supervision, but has ready access to advice from more experienced team members.




Tasks involve a degree of forward planning and anticipation of needs/issues.




Resolves non-routine issues escalated from more junior team members.




Essential Functions




Performs the scheduled tasks required to maintain the product and price information for drug and medical supplies & equipment items in each province and territory
Uses documented processes to apply provincial coverage data and price changes from the source files for each field in the database and prepare the data for upload.
Performs peer review and quality assurance checks in the application following the data change
Prepares the price and coverage data required for custom programs
Resolves and responds to Provider and Customer queries regarding information in the database
Analyzes price and provincial program changes for impact to customer benefit plans
Identifies trends and opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies




Qualifications




High School diploma.
Graduate from a Pharmacy Technician/Assistant program
Effective organizational and time management skills to meet firm turnaround times
Critical thinking for decision making
Ability to work individually and in a team setting
Meticulous attention to detail
Advanced MS Excel skills
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Bilingualism (French & English) is an asset




Express Scripts Canada Is a Cigna Company




Express Scripts Canada is a subsidiary of Express Scripts, a Cigna company. Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, wellbeing and peace of mind of those we serve. Cigna offers an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioural health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products.




About Express Scripts Canada




Express Scripts Canada is a leading health benefits manager and has been recognized as one of the most innovative. Our clients include Canada's leading insurers, third party administrators and governments. We work with these clients to develop industry-leading solutions to deliver superior healthcare in a cost-controlled environment. We provide Active Pharmacy™ services to more than 7 million Canadian patients and adjudicate more than 100 million pharmacy, dental, and extended health claims annually. Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.




It will be a condition of employment that the successful candidate obtains an Enhanced Reliability Clearance from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to provide supporting documentation to receive clearance if required.




We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a positive work environment built on solid corporate values, integrity, mutual respect, collaboration, passion, service and alignment.




We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace. By embracing diversity, we build a more effective organization that empowers our employees to be the best that they can be.




We are committed to creating a working environment that is barrier-free and we are prepared to provide accommodation for people with disabilities.




If you require accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: eschr2@express-scripts.com Do not email eschr2@express-scripts.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

If you are an active McGill employee (ie: currently in an active contract or position at McGill University), do not apply through this Career Site. Login to your McGill Workday account and apply to this posting using the Find Jobs report (type Find Jobs in the search bar).

Position Summary

A French position summary will follow:

The Media Ecosystem Observatory at McGill University is seeking applications for a full-time Academic Associate position with expertise in data and software engineering. The candidate will be joining the Centre at a stimulating time of growth and expansion and will manage and help drive a growing research agenda.

The Successful Applicant Will Have

facility with Python, SQL, and the Linux command line (bash)
experience with at least one traditional RDBMS database management (such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, or similar solutions)
experience with at least one message-queue (job-queue) system, such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, etc.
experience with cloud computing, including provisioning and running a server (AWS EC2 or equivalent)
experience with web scraping, particularly by automating browsers (Selenium or an equivalent solution)
willingness to learn and explore new technologies on the job
familiarity with version control (Git) and effective communication skills to develop code in tandem with others

The Successful Applicant May Have

experience with NoSQL or NewSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Druid, CockroachDB, etc.
experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and the process of containerizing code and using serverless architectures in the cloud, and/or familiarity with scheduling jobs in computing clusters using Slurm
experience working with social media data
have published in the area of misinformation, disinformation, and information ecosystem studies, and be familiar with the academic publishing process
familiarity with MLOps, or training ML classifiers
the ability to communicate effectively in French

Specific Duties

Under the Direction of the Media Ecosystem Observatory leadership, the successful candidate will be expected to fulfill the following duties:

Help design a data pipeline to ingest social and news media from the web, archive that data in an orderly and cost-effective manner, and render that data accessible (with minimal latency) to researchers.
Help write code to implement the pipeline. The code will be deployed in the cloud to scrape social and news media sites, insert the scraped data into a scalable backend database, and render the data accessible (with minimal latency) to researchers, facilitating research into misinformation, disinformation, and the information ecosystem in Canada and comparable countries around the world.

Contract Details

This position is a full-time contract position for one (1) year, with possibility of renewal.

Salary

The salary will be commensurate with experience and education level.

Education

Post-secondary degree in computer science or commensurate experience.

The Following Supporting Documents Are Required

A cover letter
Curriculum vitae and/or Github profile
The names and contact information of two references

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Résumé Du Poste

The Media Ecosystem Observatory de l'Université McGill sollicite des candidatures pour un poste d'associé académique à temps plein avec une expertise en ingénierie des données et des logiciels. Le candidat se joindra à l'Observatoire à un moment stimulant de croissance et d'expansion et gérera et aidera à diriger un programme de recherche en pleine expansion.

Le candidat retenu devra

une facilité avec Python, SQL et la ligne de commande Linux (bash)
une expérience d'au moins un système de gestion de base de données RDBMS traditionnel (tel que PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB ou des solutions similaires)
expérience avec au moins un système de file d'attente de messages (job-queue), tel que Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, etc.
une expérience de l'informatique en nuage, notamment de l'approvisionnement et de l'exploitation d'un serveur (AWS EC2 ou équivalent)
expérience en matière de scraping web, en particulier en automatisant les navigateurs (Selenium ou une solution équivalente)
volonté d'apprendre et d'explorer de nouvelles technologies dans le cadre du travail
une bonne connaissance du contrôle de version (Git) et des compétences de communication efficaces pour développer du code en tandem avec d'autres personnes.

Le candidat retenu peut avoir

une expérience des bases de données NoSQL ou NewSQL, telles que MongoDB, Cassandra, Druid, CockroachDB, etc.
une expérience avec Docker, Kubernetes et le processus de conteneurisation du code et l'utilisation d'architectures sans serveur dans le cloud, et/ou une familiarité avec l'ordonnancement des tâches dans les clusters de calcul à l'aide de Slurm.
expérience de travail avec les données des médias sociaux
avoir publié dans le domaine de la désinformation et des études sur l'écosystème de l'information, et être familiarisé avec le processus de publication universitaire
être familiarisé avec les MLOps ou la formation de classificateurs ML
capacité à communiquer efficacement en français

Fonctions Spécifiques

Sous la direction de l'Observatoire des écosystèmes médiatiques, le candidat retenu devra accomplir les tâches suivantes :

Aider à concevoir un pipeline de données pour ingérer les médias sociaux et d'information à partir du web, archiver ces données d'une manière ordonnée et rentable, et rendre ces données accessibles (avec un temps de latence minimal) aux chercheurs.
Aider à écrire le code pour mettre en œuvre le pipeline. Le code sera déployé dans le nuage pour analyser les sites de médias sociaux et d'information, insérer les données analysées dans une base de données évolutive et rendre les données accessibles (avec une latence minimale) aux chercheurs, facilitant ainsi la recherche sur la désinformation et l'écosystème de l'information au Canada et dans des pays comparables à travers le monde.

Détails du contrat

Ce poste est un contrat à temps plein d'une durée d'un (1) an, avec possibilité de renouvellement.

Salaire

Le salaire sera proportionnel à l'expérience et au niveau d'éducation.

Formation

Diplôme postsecondaire en informatique ou expérience équivalente.

Les Pièces Justificatives Suivantes Sont Requises

Une lettre de motivation
Curriculum vitae et/ou profil Github
Les noms et coordonnées de deux personnes de reference

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour un entretien seront contactés.

McGill University is committed to equity and diversity within its community and values academic rigour and excellence. We welcome and encourage applications from racialized persons/visible minorities, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, and persons of minority sexual orientations and gender identities, as well as from all qualified candidates with the skills and knowledge to engage productively with diverse communities.

At McGill, research that reflects diverse intellectual traditions, methodologies, and modes of dissemination and translation is valued and encouraged. Candidates are invited to demonstrate their research impact both within and across academic disciplines and in other sectors, such as government, communities, or industry.

McGill further recognizes and fairly considers the impact of leaves (e.g., family care or health-related) that may contribute to career interruptions or slowdowns. Candidates are encouraged to signal any leave that affected productivity, or that may have had an effect on their career path. This information will be considered to ensure the equitable assessment of the candidate’s record.

McGill implements an employment equity program and encourages members of designated equity groups to self-identify. It further seeks to ensure the equitable treatment and full inclusion of persons with disabilities by striving for the implementation of universal design principles transversally, across all facets of the University community, and through accommodation policies and procedures. Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence, accessibilityrequest.hr@mcgill.ca.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

Job Description




The Rotman Research Institute at Baycrest has an opportunity for a




RESEARCH ASSISTANT, LEVEL 1 OR 2




TEMPORARY FULL TIME




(Approx. 12 Months, Renewable)




70 Hours Bi-Weekly | Non-Union| Days Shift




The successful applicant will support clinical research projects focused on understanding and treating mood and memory disorders in older adults using neuropsychological assessments, behavioural task paradigms, neuroimaging, and brain stimulation. This position requires some flexibility to be available on evenings or weekends to accommodate recruitment, screening, or assessments of research participants, and to work remotely or travel to Baycrest, depending on current public health guidelines. The successful applicant will work in a fast-paced lab that provides experience in a wide variety of research-related tasks in a clinical research setting.




The Rotman Research Institute (RRI) is a premier international centre for the study of human brain function. The primary research focus is on memory and the executive functions of the brain, both in normal aging and in the presence of diseases and conditions which affect the brain, such as stroke, traumatic brain injury, Alzheimer’s disease and other dementias.




Responsibilities include but are not limited to:




Database management and preparing data for presentations and peer-reviewed research papers
Assists with Health Canada regulatory submissions, progress reports, and other administrative duties
Data entry and analysis, including behavioral, neuropsychological, and imaging data
Scheduling human subjects’ interviews, screening eligible research subjects, recruitment, maintaining subject records
Scheduling and preparing for MRI or PET scans
Assisting with transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) treatment




Qualifications include but are not limited to:




A. /B.Sc. in Psychology, Neuroscience or Health Sciences related discipline plus 1 year of full-time employment as a research assistant/analyst
Experience working with older adults and individuals with mood and/or memory problems in a clinical or clinical research setting
Ability to work independently, problem-solve, and pay attention to detail
Excellent writing skill and organizational skills
Capacity to learn and adapt to new tasks quickly
Prior research experience in organizing and managing databases
Proficiency with word processing, PowerPoint, Excel and other database software packages.




Assets are:




Experience conducting basic analyses using statistical packages (SPSS) and data interpretation.
Experience with neuroimaging data collection and analysis




Date Posted: April 12, 2023




Internal Job Posting Closing Date: April 19, 2023




Total Compensation




Competitive salary and vacation
Enrolment in Extended Health and Dental Benefit Plan
Enrolment in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (“HOOPP”)
Access to 24/7 Employee Assistance Program




INTERNAL APPLICANTS: Please submit your application online through the Baycrest intranet. Failure to include your resume may affect your candidacy for this position. All communication related to this job posting will be sent to the email address used to submit your application.




EXTERNAL APPLICANTS: Please submit your application online by clicking the Apply button below.




The Rotman Research Institute is committed to fostering a climate of equity, diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. This commitment is central to, and mutually supportive of, our research excellence mandate. We welcome and respect the diversity of all members of our community, and we support an inclusive culture for our clients, families, research scientists, staff, and participants, trainees, volunteers, trustees, and partners. We welcome applications from Black individuals and other racialized persons, Indigenous Peoples, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2SA+ persons, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas within our community. We are committed to fair assessment of a candidate’s abilities, and consideration for diversity of thought, method, and experience, including non- traditional career paths. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process where needed.




Please note that Baycrest has implemented mandatory vaccination for all employees. It is a condition of employment that new employees provide proof that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to the start date of employment. This means that all new employees must have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada at least 14 days prior to their start date. In addition, it is a condition of employment that all new hires obtain and submit proof of all booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada.




Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical reason, or a reason pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation to the Human Resources department. Such situations will be considered on a case-by-case basis.




Remarkable people of Baycrest Health Sciences




are changing the future of brain health and aging.




Thank you for your interest in joining Baycrest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




Baycrest is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at recruitment@baycrest.org or 416-785-2500, ext. 2961.




All successful candidates will be required to complete a police reference check/vulnerable sector screen and submit proof of two doses of vaccination against COVID-19, unless exempt. Such exemptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

If data is the heartbeat of the enterprise, then data engineering ensures that current, accurate, and high-quality data flows to solutions that depend on it. Do you have a passion for data and enjoy collecting, transforming, and making data accessible and available for better decision making and new digital offerings?




The intermediate data developer role is a key contributor and solution provider to our data practice. Join our growing team and expand our data platform and the data services we offer to our employees and Porter Airlines customers.




Duties & Responsibilities




Design, build, and maintain ETL pipelines, and provide well defined data integration interface specifications for internal and external systems following Data architecture guidance, Technology, and Data Management governance standards
Conduct complex data analysis, interpret trends and patterns, report on results, and recommend solutions
Analyze and combine raw data from different sources to expand and enhance the subject areas in the data warehouse
Explore ways to enhance and improve data quality and reliability in the ODS, DW, and other enterprise data structures while implementing approved changes
Provide data operations support services to business and technology groups, occasionally after hours and weekends where work will be required
Maintain and support multiple projects while working with technology teams, project managers, and business groups. Become a trusted and knowledgeable partner
Understand and when needed, document business processes and requirements to enable project data analysis and design activities
Develop data test cases for business and data integration scenarios, and when needed, perform QA testing activities
Prepare data for business data analysts and data scientists to support BI services and products, as well as predictive and perspective data modeling and ML algorithms in other business areas
Administer Data Catalogs, Reference Data, and capture data lineage for data subject areas of responsibility
Actively participate in Porter’s Safety Management System (SMS), including the reporting of hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations. Understand, comply, and promote company safety policies




Behavioural Competencies




Concern for Safety: Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others
Teamwork: Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals
Passenger/Customer Service : Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers)
Initiative: Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise
Results Focus: Focusing efforts on achieving high-quality results consistent with the organization’s standards
Fostering Communication: Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus




The most critical behaviours for a data developer at Porter Airlines are:




Ownership : Taking your responsibilities seriously and making it your mission to deliver - blockers are to be overcome
Diligence : Knowing that technology and data are complex and that a thorough approach is needed to ensure data quality and integrity
Proactive : A self-starter who understands the bigger picture while looking for ways to push forward
Passionate : Cares about your craft and hungry to learn more; enjoys a challenge
Optimistic: Is naturally positive and wants to be part of the solution; you love problem- solving




Qualifications




Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar degree preferred
Excellent knowledge of database design, data warehouse methodologies, and data integration techniques
Excellent written and verbal communication skills when communicating with business stakeholders, project teams, and project managers
Experience with various SDLC methodologies and requirement gathering
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
3 to 5 years of experience developing data integration and/or ETL solutions
3 to 5 years of experience designing and developing big data or data warehouse solutions
Strong SQL experience with various database systems
Experience with AWS products and services including S3, RDS, Lambda, Redshift, Kinesis, Athena, EMR
Experience using open source programming languages such as Python
Experience in integrating software platforms using REST API framework
Excellent SQL experience with cloud based database systems such as AWS Redshift
Experience with Google products and services including Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides, Analytics
Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination




Technical Skills




3 + years of experience developing and maintaining data integration (ETL) processes using tools such as Matillion, Microsoft SSIS, or other open source products
3 + years of experience using SQL Server, RedShift, PostgreSQL, or similar databases
3 + years of experience using Python including writing and testing code, debugging programs, and integrating applications with third-party products
3 + years of experience integrating software platforms using REST APIs
3 + years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), especially Redshift, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, RDS, or other cloud services
3 + years of experience analyzing data using Google Sheets, Excel, Tableau




Company Description




Since 2006, Porter Airlines has been elevating the experience of economy air travel for every passenger, providing genuine hospitality with style, care and charm. Porter’s fleet of Embraer E195-E2 and De Havilland Dash 8-400 aircraft serves a North American network from Eastern Canada. Headquartered in Toronto, Porter is an Official 4 Star Airline® in the World Airline Star Rating®. Visit www.flyporter.com or follow @porterairlines on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

Job_title: Data Content Researcher, ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodology
Job_description:
About The Team




The ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodologies team is a new area of expertise within the ESG Methodology & Product Architecture Team at Morningstar Sustainalytics, having been previously based under Morningstar’s Managed Investment Data. The team is dedicated to developing and enhancing ESG methodologies for managed investment (fund) universes and custom client portfolios for both Sustainalytics and Morningstar products. They work across various peer groups within the broader ESG Methodology & Product Architecture Team to determine how methodologies should be reflected at the portfolio level, such as the Morningstar Sustainability (“Globe”) Ratings, while also developing fund-specific methodologies, such as Sustainable Attributes. Team members cover a wide range of content, such as Climate, Impact, and ESG Risk, while also identifying opportunities for cohesiveness across different methodologies.




About The Role




This is an exciting opportunity to own methodology development and enhancement for ESG Portfolio and Fund data. You will be working across Sustainalytics and Morningstar methodology, commercial, and technical stakeholders to develop and present methodology concepts, translate these into detailed specifications for technical and data operations teams, as well as publish methodology documentation for our clients. The role is preferred to be based in Chicago, Toronto, or Amsterdam, but applicants in Frankfurt will also be considered. A long-term remote work arrangement will not be considered for this role.




Key Responsibilities




Lead and collaborate new methodology development for portfolios and managed investments (funds) by leveraging a subject matter background of managed investment and portfolio data to translate issuer level methodology into the fund/portfolio level, as well as identifying and developing fund specific methodologies.
Presenting on methodology concepts to methodology managers and other stakeholders.
Translating a methodology concept into detailed methodology specification documents in Excel and/or Python for technical teams to understand and implement. This includes the scope and definition of data sets, methodology logic/requirements, data modelling, and examples of calculation logic or data collection processes.
Testing of internal and external validity of methodology including change/impact analyses.
Authorship of external facing methodology papers.
Supporting product managers as well as client support teams for escalations of methodology related questions, including interfacing with clients as a subject matter expert.




Qualifications




Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, with excellent academic credentials.
Minimum of three years of experience in financial services or investing.
Minimum of three years of research and/or product development experience.
Demonstrated ability to utilize data to draw insights and propose solutions.
Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate across global stakeholders.
A strong quantitative skillset, with a background in quantitative analysis, programming, statistics, econometrics, modelling, and/or big data processing considered an asset. Applicants should have a strong knowledge of MS Excel, and basic to intermediate knowledge of working with large data sets using Python, SQL/ AWS, or other basic programming skills as well as a willingness to grow that skill.




Nice to Have




Subject matter knowledge or experience with Morningstar managed investment/fund data operations and methodology is considered a strong asset.
Experience with ESG data is considered an asset, but not required. We believe the right candidate will be able to learn the subject matter and apply their experience to ESG concepts.
Experience utilizing LEAN, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies in a project management or data operations setting is considered an asset.




About Us




Sustainalytics is a Morningstar company dedicated to responsible investment with over 25 years' experience in ESG research and ratings. With an extensive client base across asset managers, asset owners and investment banks, our mission is to provide the insights required for investors and companies to make more informed decisions that lead to a more just and sustainable global economy.




As Morningstar’s ESG center of excellence we are responsible for driving both the commercial success and innovation of its ESG products as well as its overall ESG strategy.




For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com




Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Developer, Analytic Engine, Developer Framework

Job location: Ottawa, Ontario- Hybrid; Other Canadian locations - Remote

About The Team

We are a group of generalist programmers and C++ specialists, working together to democratize the creation and extension of algorithms in the RapidResponse platform. We are a fast-moving, collaborative team, and each of us is passionate about what we do. Would you like to join us on the road to something new, big, and exciting? If you have the skills below and want to work in a compelling product area – please talk to us!

What You Will Do

Use a variety of modern technologies, and work across the software development lifecycle from development through build and into testing and test automation. You will:

Develop high quality, well-crafted code that delivers value to our customers
Test the work of other team members and develop automated tests
Collaborate as a core member of our development team and across the organization
Support a variety of special projects as needed

What We Are Looking For

3+ years of industry software development experience, preferably on enterprise-scale products
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or an equivalent program
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Passion for writing well-crafted, maintainable, robust, unit-test covered code
Experience with data structures, algorithms, multi-threading, and other core software concepts
Ability to quickly grasp, prototype and communicate new technical ideas
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
A willingness to learn new technologies and development approaches
Someone who actively engages and values working collaboratively

Generalist

Professional development experience with a variety of programming languages including Java/C#, Typescript, and others

C++ Specialist

Professional development experience with C++
Knowledge of C++ STL containers

Things that Would Definitely Help

Experience building tools for developers (e.g., SDKs)
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Jenkins, and Maven or Gradle
Experience with design patterns
Experience working with cloud platform

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Job_title: Analyste de données, Gestion de l'approvisionnement
Job_description:
SOMMAIRE DU POSTE




Kruger recherche un(e) analyste de données pour son équipe de Gestion de l’approvisionnement à Montréal. L’analyste aura la responsabilité de bâtir les fonctions d’analyse et rapports en soutien aux activités de l’équipe, ainsi que de formuler de recommandations quant aux améliorations à apporter au processus d’approvisionnement, avec l’objectif de permettre aux partenaires internes de prendre de meilleures décisions guidées par l’analyse des données. Le ou la candidat.e choisi.e devra avoir un haut niveau d’attention aux détails et réaliser l’importance de fournir des rapports précis afin que l’équipe soit confiante dans la prise de décisions.




Le ou la titulaire du poste sera également propriétaire des données de Gestion de l’approvisionnement, jouant un rôle actif dans la configuration des données de Maintenance, Réparations et Exploitation (MRO), tout en étant un membre actif de l’équipe qui lancera le programme de Gestion de la performance des fournisseurs, en s’assurant de présenter le résultat des analyses aux partenaires internes et aux fournisseurs.




Le ou la candidat.e retenu.e travaillera de près avec les membres d’une équipe interfonctionnelle au sein de l’entreprise, de même qu’avec des fournisseurs. Ce rôle offre de nombreuses opportunités d’acquérir de l’expérience auprès de différentes industries.




Ce poste se rapporte au directeur, Gestion de l’approvisionnement – Biens et services indirects




RESPONSABILITÉS




Bâtir les fonctions d’analytique et de rapports en soutien aux activités du service de Gestion de l'approvisionnement, tout en recommandant des améliorations au processus d'approvisionnement.
Recueillir et analyser des données provenant de différentes sources afin de déceler des tendances, des schémas et des opportunités d’amélioration.
Maintenir, migrer et améliorer les systèmes et les bases de données, ce qui comprend la correction des erreurs de code et autres problèmes liés aux données, ou la migration vers des technologies plus récentes.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de Gestion de l'approvisionnement pour identifier les paramètres clés, développer des modèles prédictifs, effectuer la segmentation des clients et d'autres tâches analytiques.
Effectuer l’analyse exploratoire et la visualisation des données pour en avoir une meilleure compréhension.
Jouer un rôle actif dans la gestion et la configuration de nos données liées aux pièces et services MRO.
Soutenir le déploiement du Programme de gestion de la performance des fournisseurs.
Préparer des rapports et présentations afin de partager avec l’équipe de Gestion de l’approvisionnement et autres partenaires les observations et résultats d’analyses.
Travailler avec d’autres équipes au sein de l’organisation afin de développer des projets interfonctionnels d’analytique et de rapports.
Assurer l’exactitude et la cohérence des données en effectuant régulièrement des audits des sources ou en établissant un mécanisme permettant de les automatiser.
Collaborer avec les développeurs et gestionnaires afin d’identifier les opportunités d’amélioration des processus, faire des recommandations quant aux modifications à apporter aux systèmes, et participer aux initiatives liées à la gouvernance des données et à la gestion des données maîtresses.
Surveiller les tendances de l’industrie et les meilleures pratiques en matière d’analytique de l’approvisionnement pour les intégrer à nos processus.




Qualifications




FORMATION




Requis : Diplôme de premier ou deuxième cycle en informatique, science informatique, génie, statistique, mathématiques appliquées, gestion de données, systèmes d’information, science de l’information, ou autre domaine quantitatif relié [ou expérience de travail équivalente].




EXPÉRIENCE




Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience en gestion de données, incluant une expérience démontrée dans la création de rapports, la visualisation, l’analyse statistique et la cueillette de données.
Habileté démontrée à bâtir des relations professionnelles et à susciter l’adhésion des partenaires en tant que conseiller(ère) de confiance.
La connaissance du SQL est requise, notre structure de rapports actuelle étant basée sur ce langage, tandis que de l’expérience en services d’intégration de serveurs SQL (SSIS), plus particulièrement la méthode d’appariement flou (Fuzzy Matching) serait un atout.
De l’expérience en approvisionnement ou gestion de la chaîne d’approvisionnement est un atout, particulièrement dans un contexte de marchandises à haut volume tels que le domaine MRO.
La certification d’analyste Microsoft Power BI Analyst (PL-300) constitue un avantage.
De l’expérience en analytice avancée et en apprentissage machine est également un atout.




COMPÉTENCES ET HABILETÉS




Solides compétences analytiques avec la capacité de recueillir, d'organiser, d'analyser et de diffuser des quantités importantes d'informations.
Aider à identifier les données commerciales nécessaires pour mener les analyses futures et fournir les observations les plus utiles possibles.
Intérêt marqué et expérience démontrée en science des données et dans le domaine quantitatif.
Excellentes compétences en communication, avec la capacité de présenter des données complexes de manière claire et concise.
Souci du détail avec un engagement à fournir des données exactes et de qualité.
Autonomie, sens de l’organisation et des priorités.
Intérêt pour l’apprentissage des outils existants et nouveaux, et capacité d'adaptation dans un environnement de travail dynamique.
Fonctionne bien en équipe et possède d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.




LANGAGES




Le ou la titulaire du poste sera appelé.e à travailler avec des collègues bilingues (français/anglais) ou unilingues anglophones.




La connaissance de l’anglais est requise pour ce poste spécifique, car Kruger fait affaire avec des partenaires partout en Amérique du Nord et le candidat retenu devra communiquer fréquemment avec ces derniers. Kruger a pris tous les moyens raisonnables pour éviter d'imposer la connaissance de l'anglais, notamment en évaluant les besoins linguistiques réels associés aux tâches à accomplir, en s'assurant que les connaissances linguistiques déjà requises des autres membres du personnel étaient insuffisantes pour l'exercice de ces fonctions et en limitant autant que possible le nombre de postes comportant des fonctions dont l'exercice requiert la connaissance de l'anglais.

Do you believe that a company’s success depends on its people? If so, PSI is the place for you! PSI is nothing without the people who build, design, and support it. We’re looking for Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join our scaling organization and help us.




At Pacific Smoke International, our mission is to help people quit smoking by providing safer alternatives to traditional cigarettes. As the leading distributor of electronic vaporizers and award-winning vaping products in Canada, we've made significant progress since our founding in 2013. However, we have much more to accomplish for our customers, and we're looking for a culturally aligned Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join our dynamic team located in Markham.




What’s Important To Us




We are see kin g to attract individuals who share and demonstrate our core values: Judgement, Curiosity, Agility, Results, Accountability, Teamwork.




The role is highly technical and requires expert data warehouse, T-SQL, ETL, data modeling, DAX, data analytics and BI tools skillset. The incumbent will manage and develop Business intelligence infrastructure, deliver ongoing reporting and monitoring to senior management, as well as address ad-hoc data requests. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.




The ERP Implementation Specialist Will




Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities to leverage company data and data platforms, and build optimal business case for business growth
Support the scoping of BI solutions with business unit leaders to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities
Develop a clear understanding of strategic business imperatives and issues to frame requirements for reporting/dashboarding or performance measurement solutions
Working as a trusted business partner, develop and execute BI artifacts aligned with business priorities
Design and develop complex BI Solutions, from back-end components and processes to front-end user interaction/experience components/requirements
Develop Power BI data models that aggregate data from multiple sources to meet requirements, configure, and set up application gateway refreshes
Create mock-up reports for proof-of-concept reviews
Troubleshoot/test the solution and ensure the solution performs/performance-tune these solutions as necessary and document results
Develop BI solutions (data sets, reports, dashboards, descriptive analytics, etc.) within a complex and fast-paced environment using various BI technologies
Manage ad hoc requests from business leaders/users with appropriate prioritization
Build and manage report catalog with well-defined SLAs and regular compliance reporting
Follow the standard reporting process/workflow and other BI standards and best practices (including solid documentation of schedules and queries)
Transform reports/dashboards into “BI products” with a standard and consistent design and look & feel for enhanced user experience
Regularly identify usability problems and make suggestions for improvement (e.g., automation) in BI products delivered
Help automate various reports/processes using tools such as PowerAutomate, VBA macros, etc.




To Be Successful You Should Have




Proven 3 years and above hand-on experience as a BI Developer or Data Scientist
A post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Management or relevant experience
3+ years’ experience using Power BI or similar BI platform to deliver complex visuals
Minimum of three years of experience developing and implementing Power BI solutions, including modelling, design, development and testing of data visualization or paginated report solutions
Proficiency in Data Analysis (DAX), M, ETL (Power Query), SQL (or data extraction and integration tools) and performance optimization
Strong ability to work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and work within tight deadlines
Ability to communicate clearly in conversation and in presentations to both technical and non-technical staff and to provide updates to all levels of management and stakeholders
Microsoft Power BI certifications or Azure certifications are an asset
Experience working in an Agile project delivery model is an asset
Experience in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining




What You Can Expect From Pacific Smoke International




At our company, we strive to provide our team members with the best possible support. Here is an overview of the current benefits and perks we offer:




A total compensation package that includes group benefits program starting from day 1 of joining and year-end performance bonus
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to help build the career you want and hit the goals you set, while ensuring you’re reaching your fullest potential
Tuition Reimbursement
Three weeks of Vacation
Hybrid (1-2 days onsite)
Awards for top performers and employee tenure
A unique opportunity to build, grow and leave your impact on a US$25-billion industry
To work with a group of people who are humble, supportive, and care about our customers
Product at distributor pricing to all employees
Company events
EAP (Employee Assistance Program) Program




If you are a results-driven, self-motivated individual who thrives in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, we invite you to join our team at PSI. You will have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of people nationwide while working in an inclusive and supportive environment.




Thank you to all the applicants who have shown interest in this position. We appreciate the time and effort you have taken to apply.




While we carefully review every application we receive, we regret to inform you that only the candidates who are being considered for further evaluation will be contacted.




Pacific Smoke international is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarian's with Disabilities Act (AODA), we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.
