Job_title: Jr. Realtime Digital Control System Software/Systems Technologist
Job_description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

The Computer Systems Engineering department is responsible for digital instrumentation and control equipment for projects involving control, monitoring and operator displays in the nuclear island for our existing domestic and international customers and new builds. We are responsible for digital system design, equipment selection and procurement, and all software activities.

How will you contribute to the team?

A real‑time computer software technologist is required to work on the design, development, verification, documentation, and testing of computer system software for internal products and projects involving new CANDU nuclear power plant computer architectures/designs and/or computer retrofits to existing nuclear plants and installations.

All duties will be carried out under the general supervision of a Senior Computer Systems Engineer or Technical Lead.

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

Prepare requirements and develop tools for test/development systems as needed for the production of safety critical software.
Execute software engineering tasks including software requirements specification, software design descriptions, coding, verification, testing, and documentation.
Evaluate computer vendor products and prepare processes and procedures for implementing such products into the computer software design, development and V&V processes.
Assist in planning activities associated with design, verification and testing of computerized safety, control and monitoring systems.
Assist in preparation of work-scopes, design and quality requirements, and design plans for the various stages of computer systems development.
Participate in the concept design of safety, control and monitoring computer systems to define the system requirements, computer architecture, product/tool technologies and evaluate system performance and reliability.
Assist in preparation of guides and procedures following international standards for work practices related to quality software for safety applications in the nuclear industry.
Develop software and scripts using a variety of programming languages/ toolsets/ environments including, but not limited to: IEC 61131-3 languages, C, C++, Varian / SSCI-890 Assembler, Fortran, Pascal, Visual Studio, LabView, XML, Photon.
Test script development using in-house scripting languages.
Update and/or prepare Computers Engineering design documents including software requirements specifications, software design descriptions, and software manuals.
Interface with various engineering disciplines, suppliers, and other divisions within the company.
Deliver technical presentations accurately and effectively.
Manage assigned work effectively, including prioritizing, executing, managing schedule and budget, and reporting, to meet project goals.

What will you contribute?

Diploma in a relevant field of engineering technology or computer science from a college or equivalent of recognized standing.
1 to 4 years of experience in a computer controls environment is preferred, but may be waived.
Familiarity or experience with software design/development based on documented industry or international guidelines/standards is an asset.
Demonstrate good technical skills and problem-solving capabilities, and be able to seek practical solutions to engineering problems.
Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

What We Offer At SNC-Lavalin

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!



The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Work Location: Remote, candidates must be located in Quebec, Ontario, or British Columbia

Work Schedule: Full-time, Monday – Friday during regular business hours

Engagement Model: Employment; fixed-term/temporary

Project Duration: 3 months with a possibility of extension

Start Date: ASAP

* Candidates are expected to have their own computer and headset *




DataForce by TransPerfect is currently looking for Portuguese speakers to join our team! This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a global team and work on an innovative project to improve Artificial Intelligence and technology.

This is a fully remote employment opportunity. This role requires a high level of independence, adaptation, and accuracy – love of attention to detail will help you succeed in this role!




Role Summary

As a Language Data Analyst, you will work on speech or text recognition, different input methods, keyboard/swipe technology, or other areas of human-machine interaction related to languages.




Role Responsibilities

Classify, transcribe, sort, label, and annotate data




Job Requirements

Idiomatic fluency in Portuguese
Eligible to work in Canada, must be located in: Quebec, Ontario, or British Columbia provinces
Great reading and comprehension skills
Ability to meet daily KPIs
Excellent time management skills
Ability to work independently
Flexibility to respond and react to changing priorities, quickly and efficiently
Ability to track, analyze, and report issues
Detail-oriented and comfortable with repetitive tasks

No previous experience or training in the field is required - we will provide training.




DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.




We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $40 – $60/hr

THE OPPORTUNITY

Our client is a technology consulting company based out of Chicago, IL. Their mission is to increase efficiency, reduce cost and scale businesses in the professional services industries through customizing technology and automating processes. They do this through consulting, implementation and maintenance. They have experience with customizing and automating a variety of technology solutions including Microsoft Office 365 as well as connect with other applications using API’s.

They believe in building meaningful relationships, sharing their knowledge and creating opportunities for underrepresented communities. As a minority and first-generation American owned business, they are a proud equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce and encourage women and people of color to apply.

What They Offer:

Working with a diverse team
Flexible work schedule and work life balance
Ability to work remotely from anywhere
Hands-on experience with new technologies
Exposure to all parts of the business
Working closely with the leadership team
Mentorship and growth opportunities
Ability to have direct and meaningful impact on the business


What They Look For:

Creative problem solvers
Integrity and taking pride in your work
Self-starters with an entrepreneurial mindset
Team-oriented, communicative and open-minded
Comfortable giving and receiving feedback
Genuine interest in learning, growth and team building
Flexible and can keep up with a shifting fast-paced environment


What You'll Be Doing:

As a Power Automate Developer, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, testing and maintaining custom business apps and custom automation for wide-ranging clients using the Microsoft Power Platform. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Learning and understanding the list of Power Automate Flows that make up a particular solution
Implementing automation solutions and workflows through gathering requirements
Update flows to meet changing requirements
Documenting processes and developing, testing, and deploying solutions using the Power Platform
Understanding SharePoint

3+ years of working on Power Automate
Experience in Power Platforms
Custom connectors
RPA
AI Builder
Solutions
Gateways
Experience with RESTful web services
OAuth 2.0 understanding
SharePoint Online, Graph API, Automated Deployments, PowerShell, SQL

Agile Methodology
Power Virtual Agent is a plus
Power Apps is a plus
Microsoft Certification PL-200, PL-600 or PL-900 is a plus
Startup experience is a plus


This is a contract position with the potential to convert to full time.

Apply Now!

We are hiring freelance English and French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and French
You must be living in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Are you an experienced OutSystems developer currently living in Canada and looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work with a dynamic, innovative team focused on driving results? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!




Accelerated Focus is seeking a mid-level OutSystems developer to join our team in Canada. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and developing high-quality OutSystems solutions for our customers. You will work closely with our team and the customer to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet our customers' needs.




To be successful in this role, you will need to:




Align with our Core Values.
A natural excitement for technology, developing and delivering customer value.
3+ years of experience developing software using OutSystems.
Demonstrated understanding of OutSystems best practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
Experience working in an agile development environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.
Thirst for knowledge and inquisitive tendencies – You always ask “why?” and constantly look for better and new ways of doing things.




Bonus points if you have any of the following:

OutSystems certifications.
A great story for why you chose to go on the OutSystems journey.
Skills in the following: RESTful services, .Net, C#, HTML, CSS, jQuery, and Microsoft SQL Server.
Basic understanding of UX/UI guidelines.




If you are passionate about software development and have a track record of delivering high-quality solutions, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer a competitive salary, flexible work hours, a collaborative and supportive work environment, retirement matching in North America, and an amazing corporate culture. 




We look forward to receiving your application and discussing this opportunity further.

Description





CBN creates customized, secure technology solutions for governments across the globe. Our customers look to us to design secure solutions to protect their borders, manage and confirm the identity of their citizens and manage the complexity of motor vehicle regulation. All over the world, people travel safely through borders, trust local currency and carry reliable ID because of the information systems and documents that we design and build.



What’s In It For You?

Working as a Systems Developer in our ID Software Development group, you will be assigned various tasks that will provide an opportunity for hands-on learning under guidance of one of our Senior Systems Developers. You will gain invaluable experience in developing reports, database design and hardware configuration. That said, we don’t want to pre-define the role too much as we encourage our people to think beyond job descriptions and explore areas of interest in which they demonstrate an aptitude. As an active member of our friendly and welcoming team, you will also have a plethora of opportunities to develop your communication and interpersonal skills in formal and informal settings (like down in the cafeteria on Tim Horton’s Fridays!)



What Will You Do?

 

Provision and deploy new servers in a consistent fashion though the use of a Puppet Master server. Create and manage virtual machine Linux servers. Create and maintain Puppet classes for automated server and software deployment. Perform testing to ensure functionality. Ensure backwards capability with existing server infrastructure.
Provide operational support for Linux servers in a development and test-lab environment. Manage a set of Linux servers. Analyze server logs to assist in troubleshooting software problems. Research and propose solutions to operational issues. Gather performance metrics and tune server performance.
Create and maintain a set of BIRT reports that will provide insight into the transactional data stored in a relational database.  Understand and analyze reporting requirements against a target database schema (Postgres/Oracle). Perform unit-tests on reports. Implement bug fixes. Conduct stress testing and performance testing.
Evaluate current schema suitability and adapt the design to fit changing requirements. Implement database changes. Document changes to database objects.  Provide database support to software developers and testers. Monitor database performance.




What Will Help You Succeed? 

Success in this position will require a diversified set of skills, attained either through education or relevant work experience. Beneficial technical knowledge sets are listed below – but don’t despair if you don’t have them all – so long as you are passionate about technology and have an appetite for learning, we still want to hear from you! 



Knowledge/Experience

System administration (Linux, Windows Server, Windows 10)
Configuration management and automation tools (e.g. Puppet)
Virtualization and backup tools
Monitoring and performance metrics
Container technologies (e.g. Docker)
Install and configure new databases
Performance tuning incl. SQL optimization
Perform backups and restores
Database replication configuration
Storage management




Technologies:
       PostgreSQL, Oracle, Linux, Windows Server



Soft Skills

Self-organized, self-directed learner
Good communication skills and team collaboration


People who enjoy variety and think beyond their job descriptions succeed here. As part of the team at CBN, your job is to take your career in new directions and be part of our customer’s success stories. So, if you’re looking for the chance to work for a global technology company, explore new opportunities, and deliver exceptional work to your customers, we want to hear from you!

Votre mandat sera de centraliser, normaliser et standardiser les données de nos systèmes d’opérations afin de fournir des tableaux de bord à la direction pour faciliter la prise de décisions d’affaires.




Pour Ce Faire, Vous Devrez




Comprendre et traduire les exigences des analystes commerciaux en livrables exploitables.
Améliorer la collecte de données en fournissant des procédures ETL pour inclure des informations pertinentes pour la construction de systèmes analytiques.
Travailler avec les analystes des systèmes informatiques pour identifier les informations pertinentes à extraire des ERP opérationnels.
Développer des modèles d'entrepôt de données pour l’intelligence d’affaires.
Coordonner ou réaliser, selon la nature du problème, un support technique pour les utilisateurs de l'application BI.
Documenter et suivre l'inventaire des données.




Ce que nous recherchons




Minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans un rôle d’analyste développeur ETL, SSRS
Très bonnes connaissances en requêtes SQL et en procédures T-SQL
Maîtrise de l’anglais requise (échanges réguliers avec des collègues et partenaires basés en Ontario et aux États-Unis), la connaissance de l’espagnol est un atout




Notre offre




Milieu de travail dynamique et hautement stimulant où vous pourrez faire votre marque, bénéficier de multiples occasions de perfectionnement et mener une carrière impressionnante.
Régime de retraite et avantages sociaux flexibles que vous pouvez personnaliser selon vos besoins et ceux de votre famille (compte de dépenses pour soins liés au mieux-être, accès à des services gratuits de soins de santé virtuels - télémédecine).
Des avantages pour les employés, comme des réductions auprès de fournisseurs de divers produits et services, y compris des assurances, des forfaits de données, des voyages et plus.




À propos de nous




Entreprise en pleine croissance avec son centre décisionnel à Montréal, TC Transcontinental est un chef de file de l’emballage souple en Amérique du Nord et le plus important imprimeur au Canada. Nous sommes également le plus important groupe canadien d’édition pédagogique de langue française. Notre équipe compte 8300 employés à travers le monde, dans 41 installations de production, avec des revenus de plus de 3 milliards de dollars canadiens pour l’exercice financier clos le 30 octobre 2022.




Le respect, le travail d'équipe, la performance et l'innovation sont au cœur de notre entreprise, et nous voulons partager ces valeurs avec vous. Rejoignez notre grande famille!

Description




Le RID Laval-Sherbrooke (RID-LS) est composé d'une équipe multidisciplinaire dédiée à assurer le partage des examens d'imagerie médicale de façon provinciale. Relevant du chef de service, le candidat recherché sera responsable d’effectuer la gestion et l’exploitation des données utilisées par l’équipe. Il soutiendra l’équipe de développement dans la création et le maintien d’un outil de gestion permettant à l’équipe d’offrir le maintien d’un haut niveau de qualité de données. Il sera aussi appelé à développer des rapports et tableaux de bord afin de permettre l’exploitation de ces données.




Le poste est offert en télétravail à plein temps, en présentiel ou en mode mixte selon les préférences du candidat. L’horaire est à temps complet (35 heures/semaine) avec une possibilité de rehausser à 40 heures/semaine au choix de l’employé.




Parmi ses tâches spécifiques, le candidat retenu devra:




migrer, modéliser et optimiser la base de données existante
effectuer des correctifs et améliorations aux requêtes SQL de l’outil existant
développer des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des rapports basés sur la BD
participer à l'identification des besoins de l’équipe.
contribuer à l'architecture de la nouvelle solution et à la conception détaillée
mettre en production, assurer la qualité et soutenir des solutions développées
collaborer avec le propriétaire de produit (Product Owner) pour créer et raffiner les items du carnet de produit et les critères d'acceptation
estimer la taille et la complexité de son travail
participer à la planification en créant un plan d'itérations ainsi qu'un objectif d'équipe d'incrément de produit




Regroupant le CHUL, L'Hôtel-Dieu de Québec, l'Hôpital de l'Enfant-Jésus, l'Hôpital du Saint-Sacrement et l'Hôpital Saint-François d'Assise, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval est le plus important centre hospitalier universitaire du Québec et l'un des plus grands au Canada. Dispensant des soins généraux et spécialisés, mais surtout surspécialisés, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval dessert la population de tout l'est du Québec, soit un bassin de près de deux millions de personnes. Étroitement lié à l'Université Laval et orienté vers l'avenir, il détient également une mission d'enseignement, de recherche dans de nombreux domaines d'excellence et d'évaluation des technologies et des modes d'intervention en santé. Le CHU de Québec-Université Laval compte plus de 12 500 employés, 1 500 médecins, dentistes et pharmaciens, 338 chercheurs réguliers et associés, 169 chercheurs affiliés, de même que 927 étudiants aux cycles supérieurs et 425 bénévoles.




Exigences




posséder un Baccalauréat en informatique OU Baccalauréat dans une discipline pertinente à la fonction et 3 ans d’expérience pertinente en informatique OU Certificat en informatique et 4 ans d’expérience pertinente en informatique OU Diplôme d'études collégiales (DEC) en informatique et 6 ans d'expérience pertinente en informatique (réussite obligatoire de l'examen spécifique)
expérience de développement en langage SQL (min 6 mois)
habileté en programmation et en manipulation de données (TXT, XLSX, CSV, etc.)
habileté avec l’outil PowerBI
connaissance des bases de données Microsoft SQL Server
connaissance du système d’exploitation Linux
connaissance du langage Python,
connaissance des langages .Net et HTML
connaissance de la suite MS Office




L'examen spécifique suivant sera évalué lors de la dotation du poste (pour détenteur de DEC en informatique): Examen d'analyse.




Les diplômes exigés pour l'emploi, qui auraient été obtenus hors Québec, doivent être obligatoirement accompagnés d'une évaluation comparative des études effectuées hors Québec (ÉCEEHQ) émise par le Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l'Intégration (MIFI).




Remarques




Emploi à temps complet (35 heures/semaine ou 40 heures/semaine - au choix).




Le poste est offert en télétravail à plein temps, en présentiel ou en mode mixte selon les préférences du candidat.




Toute demande d'emploi doit être accompagnée des documents attestant que les exigences de l'emploi sont respectées: copie de diplômes et /ou relevés de notes, curriculum vitae, copie d'attestation, s'il y a lieu.




Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous communiquerons uniquement avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.




Le CHU de Québec-Université Laval applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d'adaptation pourront être offertes, sur demande, selon la situation.

We are hiring freelance English and French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and French
You must be living in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).




This position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits .




Location - North campus. This role is hybrid with a mix of remote and in person




Working for the University of Alberta




The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.




The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.




Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just




Department Summary




Information Services & Technology (IST) provides the services related to Information and Technology. Enterprise Applications is a unit within IST which is primarily responsible for the development and support of the applications used across the university to conduct and integrate business processes.




Position Summary




Enterprise Applications is recruiting for an Automation System Analyst within the Process Automation Services (PAS) team. Reporting to the Manager of Process Automation Services, this position will fulfill a key technical role in enabling business areas to improve and optimize the execution of business processes and services. This position will work directly with senior business analysts, business clients and internal Information Services and Technology (IST), to transform business processes using automation technology solutions. The objective of the team is to assist business areas in achieving operational goals and objectives by reducing routine, systematic processes using robotic process automation (RPA) tools. This position will be actively involved throughout the engagement cycle (identify, assess, manage, and measure) to translate opportunities into realized business value.




As a Automation System Analyst, this position will be responsible for development and implementation of process automation solutions using RPA tools in conjunction with a variety of technologies (including chatbot technology) and associated business applications (e.g., Oracle PeopleSoft). This position will be required to adhere with existing technology architecture, infrastructure, processes and policies defined by Information Services and Technology (IST). This position will participate in and consult in the development and planning of RPA architecture, standards and controls, to define, develop and grow knowledge across operational teams to sustain the full lifecycle of technology solutions, including continuous improvement, operational monitoring and end of life exit strategy.




Enterprise Applications is looking for a committed and knowledgeable developer highly motivated with experience participating in project and operational teams tasked with delivering value-driven solutions. This opportunity is focused on the continued expansion of the automation practice area with RPA and chatbot technologies. The position will develop and document solutions working with RPA tools like UIPath. The position will be responsible for adherence to best practice in development to ensure maintainable and easy to understand programming, processes, procedures and outputs. The position will be responsible for performing day-to-day operations, and problem solving of RPA processes as required.




Duties




Develops and implements technical solutions to deliver on business requirements.
Works on projects that require expertise in technical environments as well as in University business areas.
Works with area and IST colleagues to understand business requirements and to define project scope.
Provides advice to the requesting area on alternative and/or recommended approaches to solutions which meet their specific business requirements.
Participates in the technical development stages to resolve issues with business requirements and to propose technical solutions.
Contributes to the review of best practices and possible technical solutions.
Provides time estimates associated with design and implementation.
Completes the technical design for components or small projects based on documented requirements and/or program specifications.
Writes, debugs or modifies programs using various computer languages. Develops custom code for applications/systems or configures/modifies software systems/products in order to meet specific business requirements.
Completes assigned development tasks within specified time frames.
Documents all aspects of the implementation and prepares documentation in accordance with IST standards and practices.
Defines, develops, and performs application testing procedures.
Participates in the creation of test plans, test scenarios and test scripts.
Participates in all phases of testing including, but not limited to, system, integration, acceptance, regression, and performance
Identifies defects during all phases of the project (application design, test, production implementation, and post-implementation phases) in coordination with other technical and business groups.
Takes ownership of technical issues.
Works with project leads and managers to prioritize issue resolution.
Communicates task, issue, and system status to project leads and managers.
Acts as technical liaison to internal business analysts and business clients.
Answers questions related to using the application/ system.
Continuously evaluates changes in emerging technologies that can improve or enhance solution and service delivery.
Remains current with relevant development and project methodologies.
Remains current with frequent updates and changes to implemented technology.




Minimum Qualifications




Undergraduate degree or diploma in Computer Science, undergraduate Math w/specialization in Computational Sciences, or equivalent work experience may be considered




Preferred Qualifications




Experience working with automated solutions containing processes, queues, and environments and developed best practices are nice to have.
Experience implementing RPA tools such as UIPath, Automation Anywhere, or Blue Prism are nice to have.
Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, and client-oriented service.
Comfortable directly interacting with clients and internal teams.
Advanced analytical and technology problem solving skills

Who We Are

We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.

CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Learn about our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and the work being done to create a more inclusive and welcoming organization by focusing on how we learn, govern and practise.

At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts

Why is this role important?

The Analyst plays a key role in organizing and leveraging the pan-Canadian data CIHI holds.

This may involve data management, developing and maintaining data and information

standards (e.g. indicators), preparing relevant documentation, providing client support,

assessing data quality, producing statistics, fulfilling custom data requests, and conducting

analysis. Analysts will participate in department/branch projects and initiatives, as well as other

meetings and special projects as required.

What You'll Do

Completes regular user acceptance testing, quality assurance testing and other maintenance activities for CIHI’s analytical tools, Portal and YHS: Insight, to ensure continuous quality improvement and support for our users. Updates documentation for end-users as required (e.g., release notes, metadata, user guides)
Works with the Lead and other members of the analytical team to support the production of key deliverables for internal and external dissemination. Key deliverables include relevant documentation, data tables, custom data requests, and topical analytical reports.
Conducts data management activities including writing and updating statistical code

required for the development, computation, analysis, and/or verification of key

deliverables. This may include support for the release of data and information through private and public reporting tools, including leading the execution of test strategies / test cases to ensure accuracy of the reported results in adherence with CIHI’s corporate information quality framework.

Maintains detailed knowledge of data, tools, and analytical techniques used to produce standard and ad-hoc outputs.
Conducts environmental scans and literature reviews to support the development of

reports, statistics, and indicators.

Supports the development of materials (e.g., analytical reports, methodology or technical notes, presentations, educational, media, etc.) for dissemination of findings and knowledge translation, and reviews written products for analytic accuracy and quality.
Provides professional and timely client support to respond to internal and external client queries as required.
Ensures adherence to, and ability to demonstrate compliance with, CIHI’s privacy and security policies and procedures when using CIHI data and information.
Maintains current knowledge of CIHI’s data holdings, trends in health services research and health policy, and stakeholder information needs to support current work and contribute to the development of new analytic proposals.
Participates in other corporate project teams as required.

What You'll Bring To The Table

Undergraduate degree in a related field.
One to two years related experience working with relational databases / large datasets,

including manipulating, maintaining and preparing data and presenting analyses and reports for different audiences.

Experience with data manipulation and statistical software, such as SAS, R, Python or other statistical software is essential.
Experience with quality assurance testing
Experience in use of Microsoft Office applications.
Ability to demonstrate flexibility and initiative in adapting quickly in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team with

minimal supervision.

Proven organizational and time management skills, with an ability to manage multiple projects and priorities effectively to meet deadlines.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Fluency in English is required, bilingualism is an asset.

To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.

We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Please note the CIHI Recruiting Team uses email to communicate with applicants. Please make sure your profile has an updated email address that is checked regularly, including the junk/spam mail folder, as we send time sensitive emails (i.e. testing and interview bookings).

DescriptionDescription de posteAppartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers.En tant que scientifique des données à Air Canada, vous serez responsable d’orienter la portée et la méthode analytiques des projets en vous appuyant sur les mathématiques, les statistiques, l’apprentissage machine et une compréhension des enjeux opérationnels pour obtenir une structure et des connaissances à partir de données brutes. Nous sommes à la recherche d’un scientifique des données pour contribuer à mettre au jour l’information dissimulée dans une grande quantité de données et nous aider à prendre des décisions plus judicieuses et ainsi optimiser les produits et services que nous offrons. Votre principale responsabilité consistera à appliquer des techniques d’exploration des données, de procéder à des analyses statistiques et de mettre au point des systèmes de prévision de grande qualité intégrés à nos produits et services.Principales fonctions Assumer la responsabilité de la manipulation d’ensembles de données complexes et extrêmement variés provenant d’Air Canada et de sources externes afin de résoudre des problèmes concrets.  Concevoir, développer et évaluer des modèles, des produits et des solutions relevant de la science des données innovants pour les clients internes de même que pour notre équipe de science des données.  Superviser les activités quotidiennes, notamment les mises à l’essai et la maintenance des solutions de science des données.  Rédiger des codes hautement optimisés pour perfectionner notre boîte à outils et nos pratiques internes en matière de science des données.  Travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire avec des spécialistes de l’apprentissage automatique, du génie des données et de la conception, et fournir son expertise dans ces domaines.  Assurer l’optimisation des modèles de science des données, notamment la sélection et l’élaboration des fonctionnalités, en utilisant différentes techniques de la science des données.  Assumer la responsabilité de l’intégrité des données d’Air Canada fournies à des tiers.  Assurer l’amélioration continue des procédures de collecte des données, y compris les renseignements pertinents pour la conception de solutions analytiques.  Assumer la responsabilité de l’intégrité des données utilisées pour l’analyse et la modélisation.  Développer des processus automatisés pour l'analyse de données à grande échelle.  Fournir des conseils techniques aux membres de l'équipe ayant moins d’expérience. Qualifications Maîtrise ou doctorat dans le domaine de l'informatique, de l'apprentissage automatique, de la statistique appliquée ou des mathématiques  Certification CAP (Certified Analytics Professional), de préférence  De cinq à neuf ans d'expérience en tant que scientifique des données ou dans un rôle similaire  Au moins 5 années d’expérience de la modélisation statistique et des techniques d'apprentissage automatique  Excellente compréhension des techniques d’apprentissage automatique et des algorithmes comme k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM et Decision Forests  Expérience des outils courants du domaine de la science des données tels que Scikit learn, XGBoost, NumPy, fbprophet, etc.  Expérience des outils d’apprentissage automatique en nuage (Azure ML, databricks), un atout  Expérience en programmation dans au moins deux des langages suivants : R, Python, Scala, SQL  Au moins 5 années d’expérience à appliquer des méthodes liées à la science des données à des problèmes d’affaires  Au moins 5 années d’expérience à appliquer des méthodes analytiques et statistiques avancées dans le monde commercial, de préférence  Aptitudes avérées pour les présentations et la communication, avec habileté à expliquer des concepts analytiques complexes à des personnes d’autres domaines  Connaissance des langages informatiques distribués tels que PySpark  Expérience des outils de visualisation des données tels que plotly, seaborn, matplotlib, etc.  Connaissance de l’informatique répartie  Au moins 5 années d’expérience avec des outils de visualisation des données comme D3.js et GGplot  Maîtrise des langages d’interrogation comme SQL, Hive et Pig  Au moins 5 années d’expérience d’utilisation des bases de données NoSQL comme MongoDB, Cassandra et HBase  Bonnes compétences pour les statistiques appliquées comme les distributions, les essais statistiques et la régression  Bonnes compétences pour la préparation de scripts et la planification  Esprit d’équipe, habileté à motiver et à aider une équipe de travail interfonctionnelle à atteindre ses objectifs  Personne passionnée par les données Conditions D’emploi Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisationsrequises pour le poste. Exigences LinguistiquesÀ compétences égales, la préférence sera accordée aux candidats bilingues.Diversité et inclusionAir Canada est résolument engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant qui met en valeur la contribution unique de nos employés au succès de notre entreprise.En tant qu'employeur qui garantit l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous encourageons les candidatures les plus diverses afin de pouvoir nous doter d’un effectif varié et représentatif de nos clients et des communautés où nous vivons et offrons nos services.Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées.

Nous recherchons un ingénieur de données qui sera responsable de la maintenance, de la configuration et de la mise en œuvre de notre pipeline de données sur Azure et AWS.

Les compétences de l'ingénieur de données comprennent également la familiarité avec plusieurs langages de programmation et la connaissance des méthodes d'apprentissage de la machine.




Si vous avez le souci du détail, d'excellentes capacités d'organisation et de l'expérience dans ce domaine, nous aimerions vous connaître.




Vous serez responsable de plusieurs projets stimulants :




Évaluer les besoins et les objectifs de l'entreprise
Interpréter les tendances et les modèles
Préparer les données pour les rapports et les tableaux de bord
Combiner des informations brutes provenant de différentes sources
Explorer les moyens d'améliorer la qualité et la fiabilité des donnéesCollaborer à plusieurs projets
Analyser les données brutes
Développer et maintenir des ensembles de données
Participer à des projets en apportant son expertise dans la mise en œuvre et la gestion de l'ETL
Documenter le processus et la configuration ETL
Analyser et surveiller de la performance du Data Pipeline




Vos compétences et vos aptitudes pour être heureux dans ce travail :




Détenir un baccalauréat en informatique, en science informatique ou dans un domaine connexe
Détenir 3 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire
Détenir de l'expérience pratique de conception de base de données SQL, Azure data factory
Détenir de l'expertise technique en matière de modèles de données, d'exploration de données et de techniques de segmentation

We are looking for a Data Engineer who will be responsible for maintaining, configuring and implementing our data pipeline on Azure and AWS.

CE QUE NOUS VOUS OFFRONS




At Rheinmetall Canada, we foster teamwork, leadership, and surpassing oneself, creating an environment that brings out the best in our employees and enables them to realize their potential. Everest Clinical Research (“Everest”) is a full-service contract research organization (CRO) providing a broad range of expertise-based clinical research services to worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. We serve some of the best-known companies and work with many of the most advanced drugs, biologics, and medical devices in development today.

Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Everest’s headquarters are located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada with additional sites in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, and Shanghai (Pudong Zhangjiang New District), China.

Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success.

Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength…that’s us…that’s Everest.

To drive continued success in this exciting clinical research field, we are seeking committed, skilled, and customer-focused individuals to join our winning team as Statistical Programmers for our Toronto/Markham, Ontario, Canada on-site location, or remotely from a home-based office anywhere in Canada in accordance with our Work from Home policy.

Key Accountabilities

Perform clinical trial database quality/integrity checks by generating SAS data listings, summary tables, and graphs for data reviewing and cleaning.
Develop SAS programs and generate complete, accurate and validated statistical TLGs in well-defined formats.
Program SDTM and ADaM datasets according to the dataset specifications.
Create SDTM annotated patient Case Report Forms.
Develop SDTM dataset specifications under the supervision of a Senior Statistical Programmer or a Biostatistician.
Perform data conversion between datasets with two different formats according to conversion requirements/specifications, e.g. converting from Excel data records to SAS datasets, non-CDISC compliant datasets to CDISC compliant datasets.
Manage electronic data transfers from trial sponsors or other external clinical trial data vendors, such as central laboratories or other specialty laboratories.
Document data and programming information in accordance with Corporate Governing Documents (Policies, SOPs, or Work Instructions).
Archive clinical trial data (raw data, SDTM, and ADaM datasets) and programming documentation in accordance with Corporate Governing Documents and/or clinical trial sponsor’s specific requirements.

Qualifications And Experience

A Master’s degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Computer Sciences, and Mathematics, or other relevant fields required.
At least one year of experience using SAS.
SAS certification for Base, Advanced, and Clinical Trials Programmers highly preferred.

To find out more about Everest Clinical Research and to review other opportunities, please visit our website at www.ecrscorp.com

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Everest is committed to upholding the principles of dignity, independence, integration, and equal opportunity. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and upon request we will provide accommodations for candidates participating in any part of our recruitment and selection process.

Reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence & Visualization, the Business Intelligence Engineer loves developing BI end products that provide the business with safe, trusted information to understand our business performance. Furthermore, analyzing data-related problems and develop corrective actions to fulfill visualization needs and present data in a business centric manner for end users.




An ideal candidate will have a passion to foster a team of expert data practitioners and business experts; an analytical mindset, be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, detail oriented and have desire to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. A keen interest in influencing business performance through insights is a must.




You are great at:




Design & assist in implementation of Business Intelligence solutions using MicroStrategy and Power BI

specifications as per our data governance program.

B. Sc Computer Science, Mathematics, Stats, Engineering, or equivalent work experience

Knowledge of data management fundamentals.
Hands-on experience with advanced SQL/ETL (including writing and tuning SQL scripts), experience in R and/or Python, cloud technologies and databases in a large-scale, complex business environment.
Experienced as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into business decision/operational or advanced degree

Applications Engineer

Location: Cambridge, ON (Hybrid)

Salary: $85,000.00 - $120,000.00

What We’ve Won

In 2021, Eclipse Automation was named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for the seventh consecutive year by Deloitte – and that makes us a Platinum member. It’s a prestigious designation that we’re thrilled to uphold. We’re also a six-year recipient of the Growth 500 Award, celebrating Canada’s most dynamic and successful businesses.

What’s In It for YOU?

The Eclipse team is 900+ strong, working out of 17 locations across 5 countries and 3 continents. Our people are our greatest assets and our biggest competitive advantage. That’s why we ensure that they’re taken care of with comprehensive benefit packages that support the growth and well-being along with many additional perks such as:

Tuition Reimbursement Program
On-site Employee Gym, Free Snacks, Employee Events
RRSP/DPSP Program eligible on day one
Three weeks of vacation to start
Career Development & International Exchange

When you join Eclipse Automation, you become a member of a dynamic world-wide team of experts, visionaries, dreamers, and builders whose know-how is unparalleled. A team that’s helping design and build our future, one innovation at a time.

Come and see what your future has in store. Your next exhilarating career move awaits!

About Our Engineering Teams

Our Engineering Teams help bring our ideas to life. Innovators and reinventors, their know-how is unparalleled, and their endless drive keeps them striving for excellence. They push possibilities and turn passion into world-class products to help our customers reach their ultimate potential. They’re mechanical engineers, controls software designers, applications engineers, and much more. Whether they’re building, designing, programming, or testing, our engineers breathe life into the technology of tomorrow. That’s why we need deep thinkers, problem-solvers, innovators, and industry-leaders like you – the ones that can help push us forward, and never stop striving for excellence.

Role Overview

The Applications Engineer is a key member of the sales team, responsible for developing proposals and supporting the Sales Account Managers. Key directives include maintaining and servicing specific customer accounts and responding to requests for quotations in a timely and efficient manner, while delivering the Eclipse Vision and the Eclipse Entrepreneurial Culture.

The Applications Engineer job responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

Technical

Participate in customer RFQ review meetings, either on-site at the customer or in-house
Prepare cell layout drawings for the various RFQ's
Liaise between mechanical engineering, electrical engineering and assembly manufacturing groups for technical assistance in developing concepts and processes and provide assistance in estimating labor and material costs to meet customer requirements
Liaise with suppliers to obtain estimates of major material and equipment costs required for the preparation of budgets and proposals
Prepare equipment layouts.
Participate in the elaboration of the list and schedule of technical deliverables for the
complete project as well as the corresponding list of interfaces
Write technical specifications
Technical follow-up during engineering, procurement & construction
Identify technical risks and their impact on the project & mitigate their effects
Prepares specifications and estimates costs
Provide proactive customer design support for vertically integrated components and complex electro-mechanical assemblies
Work with internal and external design and technology functions to create unique specifications and applications
Work to specific project budgets and timelines provided by Applications Manager
Prepare draft budget and quotation proposals for review with the Applications Supervisor, the Sales Manager and Key Account Managers
Attend escalation and red flags as directed by Applications Manager
Recognize problems, initiate action, assist in problem solving and evaluate results
Assist with conflict resolution at early stages

Leadership

Promote positive relations with internal customers, partners, customers, vendors, and distributors
Recommend and consistently administer policies and procedures to enhance department operations and support continuous improvement
Enforce and promote Eclipse policies throughout the entire company including Human Resources, personal development, Safety and Environmental
Recommend Eclipse Data Base improvements on an ongoing basis to increase efficiency throughout the company
Liaise between all departments as required to ensure on time delivery proposals, and internal procedures are executed in a timely manner

Project Execution

Notify the Applications Manager as early as possible if milestones cannot be met
Attend appropriate meetings when required (Opportunity Review & Short-Term Bookings)
Ensure that Company ISO Standards are followed
Work with Human Resources and abide to Employment Standards Act and the Eclipse Employee Handbook
Promote environmentally and ergonomically safe conceptual product and/or processes to ensure safety of Eclipse personnel and the customer’s employees
Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the Eclipse Automation Inc. Conduct Code
Adhere to the Eclipse Project Operating Policy
Maintain company confidentiality and ensure employees know accurate information as required
Maintain good corporate citizen role in support of the Eclipse corporate Vision
Foster the development of a culture reflective of the core values of the business
Represent the company at various community and/or business meetings to promote the company
Complete other duties and projects as assigned
Expectation of travel up to 30% of time could be anticipated, however may be exceeded in exceptional circumstances to meet project needs

Qualifications

8+ Years of applications engineering experience in the Automation industry
University Degree or College Diploma in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or Mechatronics
Must have excellent experience with AutoCAD and Solid Works and be familiar with MS Office
Experience with hydraulics, pneumatics and electrical controls and integration of equipment
Experience and working knowledge of most CSA, ANSI and CE standards
Work requires professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to motivate teams to produce quality proposals within tight timeframes, with changing priorities
Conflict resolution skills are and asset
Must be self-motivated and lead by example with a positive attitude and outlook in the company

About Eclipse

Here at Eclipse Automation, creation and innovation is at our core, and our culture reflects that. Fast paced and continuously fostering growth, we encourage the entrepreneurial spirit that our Teams embody, and leverage each of their strengths to do better for our people, our clients, and our communities.

Our teams are made up of are innovators, thinkers, and doers, with the know-how and expertise to exceed expectations, and the relentless spirit to create and reinvent. Our people are what enable us to live up to our name – to eclipse all others, inspiring and creating outcomes that change the world.

Eclipse is an AODA compliant organization, and accommodations are available upon request.

We support an environment where teams work together and where people can learn, grow, and thrive.

Job_title: CL-IMT Management Consultant, Strategist and Planner (DRAS program - Data Solutions Analyst)
Job_description:
***IMPORTANT***




Please note the below important items regarding REQUISITION # 167998 CL-IMT Management Consultant, Strategist and Planner (DRAS program - Data Solutions Analyst)




Question Deadline




All questions with regard to this requisition must be submitted to *** and must be received by Friday April 14th, 2023, at 2:00PM Mountain Time (MT).




Additional Delivery Details To Be Shared With Potential Candidates




Provides leadership, advice and direction on data and information governance and stewardship best practices to members of executive, the governance council, stewards from lines of business, and program partners.




Facilitate an improved understanding and leverage of information and data assets.




Notes On Computer Equipment




Resource will require own equipment. Resource will be provided access to a virtual desktop.




In the event that the Contractors resources are directed to work remotely, the Contractor shall be responsible for providing all of its equipment, including computers, software, printers, supplies, desks and chairs. However, the Province shall ensure that the Contractors resources have the necessary access and credentials to the Government of Albertas system.




In the event that, the Contractors resources are directed to work in-person, the Province shall provide the requisite office space, furniture and office supplies. However, the Contractor shall continue to be responsible for providing computers and software and the Province shall continue to ensure that the Contractors resources have the necessary access and credentials to the Government of Albertas system.




The fixed rate quoted must be inclusive of all overhead, office space and equipment, including supplies, administrative burden, mark-up and all other costs to perform the Services for the duration of the Contract.




NOTES ON LOCATION:




Resource will work remotely.




Standard Hours of work are 08:15 16:30 Alberta time




Work must be done from within Canada, due to network and data security issues.




GoA does not pay for travel to attend on-site meetings.




Complete Submissions




This requisition requires completion of the skills matrices in the VMS.




This means you MUST complete all the appropriate fields within the Flextrack VMS.




Please refer to the Vendor User-Guide for instructions on this.




The completed Resource References and Resume must be attached to your submission.




**The Province reserves the right to decline any submissions that do not include either of these documents.**




Incumbency




Previously this role was filled by a contractor, however, for this and all other opportunities, the Ministry seeks the best person to fill the role.




Rate




The maximum rate for this requisition is ***/hr.




Rates for all terms, including any extension terms, must be at or below this rate***




Submissions with rates that exceed this will be non-compliant, and automatically declined.




Scoring & Weighting




Resume/Matrix: 80%*




Pricing: 20%




A higher score is awarded in evaluation for demonstrated experience exceeding the minimum for Desirable Skill and Attributes
NOTE: The Province may establish a shortlist of Vendors/Contractors who may be requested to participate in an interview to validate claims made in their written responses and assess a candidates suitability for the role sought.




Answers provided by a candidate to questions posed during the interview phase of the selection process may result in an adjustment to the score and, therefore, potentially the ranking of the Vendor/Contractor.




Responses will be evaluated and scored based on the quality of response to the requirements and provisions of the Requisition.




The Contract, if any, will be awarded to the highest scoring compliant Vendor/Contractor based on the written response, interview (if applicable), and reference checks.




Evaluate At Interview Skills




Vendors/Contractors and their candidates should be aware that the interview phase will not only be used to validate claims made in a written response, but also to assess whether the candidate is a suitable fit for the particular role sought. Suitability will be determined based on the needs of the Department, which may include an assessment of:




Skills




In addition to the skills outlined in the matrix, the below skills may be tested at the interview level but are not part of the matrix as they cannot be objectively evaluated on a resume or matrix response




The ability to learn quickly, problem solve/troubleshoot, work independently and in a team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group.
The ability to manage stress.
The ability to manage conflict.
Ability to work with minimum mentoring.
Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
Ability to interact and collaborate with others
High customer service and ethics.




References




The GoA may conduct reference checks of proposed candidates.




The GoA may contact references, including references other than those submitted by the proposed candidate.




The proposed candidate may be rejected if, in the opinion of the GoA, the proposed resource receives unsatisfactory references.




Mandatory Training Courses




All Resources are required to take certain mandatory courses. A Resource may also be required to take other courses that are considered optional for the public service as a whole.




The general mandatory courses are subject to change, but currently include: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act training and Security awareness training.




ROLE Or CREDENTIAL SKILLS




Role or skill-specific courses may be mandatory to keep the Contractors credentials, skills or certifications current.




These costs are entirely the responsibility of the Vendor/Contractor.




Cancellation




The Ministry reserves the right to not award a Contract if no Proposal demonstrates sufficient skills to fulfill the needs of the project.




Alternatively, changes in budget or in government direction negating the need to complete this requirement may also be cause to cancel the requisition.




Acceptance




Unless noted otherwise, vendors have up to two full business days after receiving the contract (either physically or electronically) to sign and return to the ministry the applicable contract.




The Ministry will make reasonable accommodation, at the Ministrys discretion, for vendors who are not in the Edmonton area to support contract signing.




Defrief Requests




At the written request of any Vendor, the Province will conduct a debriefing to tell the Vendor why its Submission was not selected. The unsuccessful Vendors written request for a debriefing must be received by the Province within ten (10) Business Days of notification to the Vendor that it was unsuccessful.




SAMPLE Government Of Alberta CONTRACT




A sample contract has been included for your review. If you are offered a contract for this or any requisitions with any of the Ministries through the Flextrack program, this is the contract including the terms and conditions that you will be asked to sign. If you have questions/concerns about this contract, please contact the Flextrack MSP program manager and you will be connected with the ministry.

At Viral Nation, we specialize in building social-first ecosystems for brands to connect with the modern consumer journey. Our integrated solutions align strategy, talent, media, and technology with culturally relevant creativity to scale the world's fastest-growing digital brands. Viral Nation offers a fluid, creative, and growth-oriented environment that will support your ambitions to apply your talents in an open, collaborative, and fast-paced culture. Our ability to stay at the forefront of the industry has fueled our success and will guide us in paving the path forward. We're driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver strategies, and we're just getting started.

While we continuously exceed our goals, we need your help – our success is only as great as our people. Strong performance leads to high expectations, and we must keep raising the bar!

What you'll do here:

Designing, building and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable architecture and code.
Lead a team: task delegation, organization, motivation and feedback
Conduct code reviews and deployment upon task completion
Participate in the architecture and system design discussions
Participate in developing data mesh architectures and building big data pipelines
Independently perform hands on development/coding and unit testing of the applications
Collaborate with the development and AI teams and build individual components into complex enterprise web systems
Work in a team environment with product, frontend design, production operation, QE/QA and cross functional teams to deliver a project throughout the whole software development cycle
Architect and implement CI/CD strategy for EDP
Implement high velocity streaming solutions using Amazon Kinesis, SQS, and Kafka (preferred)
Ensure the best possible performance and quality of high scale web applications and services
To identify and resolve any performance issues
Keep up to date with new technology development and implementation
Participate in code review to make sure standards and best practices are met
Migrate data from traditional relational database systems, file systems, NAS shares to AWS relational databases such as Amazon RDS, Aurora, and Redshift
Migrate data from AWS Dynamodb to relational database such as PostgreSQL
Migrate data from APIs to AWS data lake (S3) and relational databases such as Amazon RDS, Aurora, and Redshift
Work closely with the Data Scientist leads, CTO, Product, Engineering, DevOps and other members of the AI Data Science teams
Collaborate with the product team, share feedback from project implementations and influence the product roadmap.
Be comfortable in a highly dynamic, agile environment without sacrificing the quality of work products.


What you need to have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
3+ years of experience as a Data application developer
2+ years of experience with Apache Kafka or Confluent Kafka
Primary responsibilities are focused on the Analysis, Design, Development, and Testing of features utilizing Confluent Kafka.
Maintain and enhance Confluent Kafka architecture, Confluent Kafka design principles, and CI/CD Deployment procedures.
Experience with building streaming applications with Confluent Kafka
Experience leading a small to medium-sized team
AWS Solutions Architect or AWS Developer Certification preferred
Experience implementing software applications supporting data lakes, data warehouses and data applications on AWS for large enterprises
Solid Programming experience with Python, Shell scripting and SQL
Solid experience of AWS services such as CloudFormation, S3, Athena, Glue, EMR/Spark, RDS, Redshift, DataSync, DMS, MongoDB, PostgresQL Lambda, Step Functions, IAM, KMS, SM etc.
Solid experience implementing solutions on AWS based data lakes.
Experience in AWS data lake/data warehouse/business analytics/
Experience in system analysis, design, development, and implementation of data ingestion pipeline in AWS
Knowledge of ETL/ELT
End-to-end data solutions (ingest, storage, integration, processing, access) on AWS
Experience developing business applications using NoSQL/SQL databases.
Experience working with Object stores(S3) and JSON is must have
Should have good experience with AWS Services – Glue, Lambda, Step Functions, SQS, DynamoDB, S3, Redshift, RDS, Cloudwatch and ECS.
Should have hands-on experience with Python, Django
Great knowledge of Data Science models
Plus to have knowledge on Snowflake


Nice to have:

Solid experience in AWS AI solutions such Recognition, Comperhind and Transcribe
Experience with Azure Data services
Experience in building MLOps Pipelines
Python, NodeJS, .NetCore, C#, Reactjs, RestAPI, Microservices, Postman, GraphQL, Mongo, Linux, Javascript, HTML5, CSS, Django


Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

Subject matter expert who provides leadership, and recommendations based on results and trends.

About Us

Eli is the women's health company making continuous hormone monitoring possible. We empower people to understand their body every day and improve their health outcomes across their lives. Hormones are at the core of our health, yet they remain a black box. Eli is on a mission to unlock this box by developing a product that provides real-time and lifelong insights from saliva.

We are a diverse, intentional, and fast-moving team driven by our mission. You will work with a small group of experienced engineers, scientists, and entrepreneurs who are shaping the future of at-home testing by developing and commercializing new technology. Eli is a venture-backed and early-stage startup. You can visit our website or check out recent press articles to learn more about us.

About The Role

Eli is looking for an AI Engineer. You will be leading the development of machine learning algorithms at Eli and their integration with our product. Your primary responsibilities will be to:

Develop and implement advanced computer vision algorithms for image analysis and data processing.
Perform algorithmic research and development for automated detection, analysis, and interpretation of images.
Design and implement prediction algorithms for various outcomes related to women's health.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate algorithms into existing systems and optimize performance.
Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations, such as IEC62304, with the support of our team.
Document development, testing, and implementation processes, adhering to documentation standards.


This description is not exhaustive. We are looking for a leader that has experience developing machine learning algorithms for products launched on the market.

About You

Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
You have 5+ years of data science and computer vision experience in an industry context.

Company Description:




Merkle is a leading technology-enabled, data-driven customer experience management (CXM) company. For over 30 years, Fortune 1,000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with us to build and maximize the value of their customer portfolios. With more than 9,600 smart, dedicated people in more than 50 offices around the world, we are still growing at a rate that outpaces the market, with 2019 net revenue of $1.1 billion.




Job Description:




Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. No sponsorship or work transfers are available for this position
Applicants must currently live in and have a permanent residence in the United States




Merkle is looking for experienced Cloud professionals to be part of its Cloud practice. You will be working on industry leading public Cloud platforms, Google Cloud Platform to design, develop, and implement next generation marketing solutions leveraging cloud native and commercial/open source big data technologies.




You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines and systems that operate on cloud-based infrastructure. You will work closely with data scientists, data analysts, and software engineers to develop and deploy data pipelines, and to ensure that data is available and accessible for analysis.




Key Responsibilities




Designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines that collect, process, and store large amounts of data on cloud platform GCP.
Implementing and managing data workflows, including data ingestion, processing, and transformation using tools such as Apache Airflow, Apache Beam.
Develop real time integrations using event driven architectures and micro services.
Developing and maintaining data storage and retrieval systems using cloud-native data stores such as S3, Google Cloud Storage.
Collaborating with data scientists and analysts to optimize data infrastructure and ensure timely access to accurate data.
Ensuring data quality and accuracy by developing and implementing data validation and verification processes.
Building and maintaining data catalogs and metadata repositories to ensure that data is easily discoverable and understandable.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to data pipelines and infrastructure.
Staying up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends related to cloud data engineering.
Collaborate with cloud architects, tech leads, front end developers, back end developers, QA, business stakeholders, and project managers to design and build services on the cloud for applications on the Web or on edge devices.
Develop reference architectures and design pattern library for typical Cloud based solutions implementations
Advise on Cloud project set up, security and role based access implementation, and network optimizations
Conduct training and enablement programs for Merkle’s internal delivery teams
Hands-on work as part of a global team and coach off shore developers
Participate in technical interactions with client’s executives and senior management
Participate in technical customer engagements such as Proof of Concepts, project delivery for key strategic opportunities.
Develop end-to-end Enterprise grade Concept Solutions, facilitate discussions with business & IT stakeholders and highlighting the outcomes that can be delivered through these solutions.




Qualifications:




Must be able to work on PST work schedule
5+ year’s design and/or implementation of enterprise applications
3-5+ years working on Google Cloud (GCP)
3+ years on Databricks, snowflake, Big query or other MPP systems
